Jmvn27-2lo15h8X7sRuaUg.text: LOVE the Nachos with sour cream on the side, as well as the chips, salsa and Margaritas.  My old "go-to" menu item was the Pollo Fundido before I changed my eating habits :)  My recommendation is to go at happy hour and sit in the bar area!

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy happy hour margaritas!!

-agDq-N1jkQrl0RBAwncBg.text: So tonight was a different experience than in the past. Tonight, we had our meal as usual. When the server brought us the check, she said "the credit card machine quit working so you have to pay cash", I said, "I have no cash, can you run it manually?". She said "Sylvia, the manager, said to go to Food City across the street, they have an ATM".  So I had to get in my car and drive in the middle of a crazy rain storm to get cash.  Had I known this when I first went in, I wouldn't have stayed OR I would have gone to the bank, get cash and come back.  I know my business means little (or nothing) to them, after all, I've only been coming here for only 11 years. I've seen some bad reviews for Poncho's on here because of poor service.  I get it now.  Sylvia, is this your idea of a back up plan? A good manager would come up with a solution that is good for both the business AND the consumer..If there was only a way to process credit cards manually.. hhhmmmm!

NcojEoBi23lSrQyuqYGqZw.text: My go-to place when I want Mexican.  Pollo Fundido  is excellent, Chili Relleno is my go-to comfort food.  We always feel welcome.  It can feel close, but the place was a house at one time.

dVN5q5sDfxfWyo6PwrFHyg.text: At Poncho's you will find good Mexican food, but there is always a weird musty smell that I can't get over.  If you do go, I reccomend the frozen margaritas.  They are poured straight out of a machine, but they are delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Hu0iVl7h6wcBByCoGFZJWQ.text: Price...Da' BOMB! Food...Da' BOMB! Service...Da' BOMB! Ponchos...Da' BOMB!  Highlight: Chicken Fundido w/ extra Jalapeno Cream Cheese...Manifiq!

E3OCUxIhTfMTWYj7aLNWgg.text: Food is amazing! I'm not a huge fan of dining in and the pick up window is shady at night but the food is worth it.

7NwFaKHlrCscKpRwHs1Uzg.text: I have been going to this place probably since I was in the womb. They have good prices and good food. I love the chips and salsa. I wish they still did the cheese crisp on mondays for free after 5pm (maybe they will bring it back hint, hint)... It is in a smaller converted house in south phoenix with a take out area in front and a bar in the back. This place fills up quick on the weekends be prepared. Only thing I do not like is sitting out in the main area when you first walk in everybody is looking at you when they walk by I prefer the back room or the bar. YUMMY...... food try it for yourself.

HoE-Yi8c-2dlAdnDcqztbQ.text: I've been coming here since before I was born, the service has changed somewhat over the years but I am always happy that the food quality has stayed the same.

iL5i_6G8qz4QNCr2osLB7A.text: Such good food. I would suggest this place to anyone visiting the area! Oh, and Autumn was an awesome server!

obcK1iWhMiZvnegH7-z3GQ.text: Very very VERY disappointed with today's food and service, not only did we wait 15 minutes for our server to greet us and take our order, my wife's chicken chimichanga was dry, greasy, and tasteless (not how it used to be) we so happened to over see the bartender while waiting for our server to greet us  stick her finger inside a customers drink take out whatever that was floating and served that same drink to a customer (VERY DISGUSTING AND UNSANITARY).  My wife and I have been coming here for years and really loved the food, but today was a HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT and we will no longer return to this place or recommend this restaurant to ANYONE!!

4CkmDnuAuO-GUbI_YsOYWQ.text: The food was not bad, but the restaurant was filthy! The service was horrible, when we asked for our server they got highly irate. Worst restaurant experience I have had in years, I would not recommend this restaurant no to anyone.

tuiNqWfSAnacUfqkdYVm4Q.text: The best Mexican food in South Phoenix. There are others good, some great but Pancho is my heart.

48B945i43LwuESGfQ95iHQ.text: Place has really gone down hill. It use to be my favorite.... But service has gone to the dumps!!! Food quality is also bad.. I'll be taking my business to Los Dos... DONT COME HERE!!!!

X8dtFWGnmPQxGaOllYF-fg.text: When President Clinton visited town he made a stop at Poncho's Mexican Food.  It struck me as an odd choice at the time, but also made me curious about the food.  Was Clinton just making a political stop or did he actually have some inside intelligence from forward operatives?  After eating at Poncho's, it was obvious that Bill knew a thing or two about Mexican food.  They have wonderful combinations and the restaurant has become a habit for our family.    PLEASE don't confuse this wonderful independent restaurant with the Pancho's Buffet restaurant.

x2B1IbeYB_q6FnmOQWPc5g.text: TALK ABOUT GHETTO!! I was disgusted to be honest. Walking into that place was like walking in to a old Crack house turned mexican restruant. First off, I don't mind driving out to a good mexican restruant, but seriously this place was so dirty, run-down, and as I could tell not run by good management. SECONDLY, and i could not believe this even happened, as soon as we sat down there was a full on fight between customers in the bill Clinton room. I had my phone out ready to call 911 because this fight was going on way to long.  It is such a small restaurant, with family and kids at just about every table. What kind of family restruant has a fight break out? A ghetto mexican restruant does. And not only that but the silverware, the pee yellow cups they use for water looks like overused cafeteria cups from the 90s. I think the only reason this place is still open is because the locals in South pheonix must not have any other authentic mexican restruants around. Anyways just so many things about this restruant is soo unappealing, i dont know why I even went. The worst experience at a restruant ive ever had. Not to mention we called earlier in the day to make reservations and they still seated us in the wrong place. Food was whatever, and service was below average.

y0x9EVRPnnz35_UBgQkz1w.text: Just because bill Clinton ate at this restaurant doesn't make it any more of a hole in the wall then it already is. . Nothing special here, I've got to admit there salsa is the bomb as in real good but the food was nothing special, very bland, service was ok. .. if you're ever on the south side of town and you need a bite to eat on your way home hit this place up prices are reasonable here. .oh!  And """Bill Clinton ate here""" as everyone likes to mention . .I guess it's a great selling point for this hole in the wall restaurant. You'll see pictures of him on the wall. .yay! !!

B2mh8j9cpyue0FwPatLBQA.text: Good food. Reasonable prices. I had the chimichanga platter with beef, rice and beans. The quantity and quality of food was excellent. Our server was quick and attentive.  Issues I found were the long wait time and the crowded entry space with people waiting for a table.

7JWriEaS5YrVEIItZWQgSQ.text: I wasn't impressed by the food or experience. We had a long wait but not enough room in the "lobby." It's a converted house so I like the character of the place. However, our service was extremely loud-for no reason-the food was just bleh, and my husband's fajitas was saucy (why, I don't know). His meat was over cooked. The highlight? The margaritas were amazing! I may go back for happy hour but probably not for food.

ymL2ZIWIYX3Kd-_RMzkB4g.text: We always order from here and typically get the same thing all the time, we went to pick up  our order tonight and they had 3 cheese crisp (we only ordered 1) 2 tacos which were correct and the other two we asked to have without lettuce they just put meat no cheese. They had the nerve to say we were wrong and that's what we ordered they actually said we called back and added! Which is insane and pathetic because we surely did not. They argued and we paid and after we paid they said we already paid for the stuff anyways so we had to take. No way we are going to eat 3 open cheese crisp. We went to find a couple homeless people and gave to them because it would have went to waste. They get zero stars I will not be going there again. I can only imagine how bad hey are with people. Thanks for nothing!!!

xkmbUYIdse4duhKE3NUFZg.text: My family's favorite local Mexican food restaurant. The best albondigas soup I've ever had, plus they have huge Ponchos Mexican pizza---a giant cheese crisp covered in green chile meat, fresh tomatoes, and fresh diced green onions. Great margaritas, too!

crxfASS3gyBW-pMuzCH-1Q.text: Ponchos ... what can I say, other than no matter how many times I have given you the chance to redeem yourself on food and service, you just always score an F. Well, okay, your bar is a site to behold and entertaining. Do I mean that in a good way? Well, if you like electronic juke box music you pay for to listen to while games are on various televisions and the crowd of 30 , or 60 or maybe the random drunk 25 year old hits on the said 55 year old in the dim lit area of loud ... sure! It's entertaining to watch ... while dining. #entersarcasm  I've not been woo'd by the customer service skills here ... ever. I have been here about half a dozen times now. The 'holding area' while you wait for a table is tight.. very tight. The hostesses are busy beyond words and barely greet you. We usually go to the entertaining bar, while we wait for a table. I told you, it's entertaining!! The one thing I do like here: the margaritas are good and they are strong. I pray the glasses are clean. I'm not sure. I just cross myself and pray, every time.  We recently ordered take out. Why? I am not sure. My husband was out and near Poncho's. He asked that I call the order in as he was leaving his venue. I tried. I was on hold for 5 minutes , the girl came on the line asking me to hold again. Okay , I said. Next, another 8 minutes. She came on again asking me to hold and I told her , 'I've been on hold for over 13 minutes now, can you just take my order?' She said , 'Please hold!' That was it. My husband beat me to this place. Insane. He said the place was nuts and one girl was running the 'take out area'. He got our food home. It was anything but appealing. It was disgusting and so incredibly greasy, I found it inedible. I thought the chips tasted like a fishy taste , which , in my opinion, meant they were cooked in old oil.. so I toasted them a few minutes. The salsa was watery. At least when you eat on property, the chips are seemingly fresh and so is the salsa. Our  meals : Enchiladas and chicken tacos , were literally swimming in oil. I refused to eat mine. Did I end up with a tummy ache later? Yes. Why, Kimberly, Why?!!! It tasted bad and it looked bad and you ate it?! Maybe I've finally learned this time!  I've eaten all over the valley and there are legitimately good Mexican food places here! THIS is not one of them ! Do I care the at ONCE upon a time President Clinton ate here? No. That was then and this is now. Maybe he didn't know truly good Mexican food and I'm sure they turned off that crazy electronic juke box that day and didn't have their rudest , curt staff waiting on him. The end , Ponchos. You are a big ball of yuck. Save yourself and if you want this level of Mexican food, go thru the drive thru at your neighborhood Bertos, those sometimes are actually good! And minus the jukebox!

vb1UJ5epmDE_quzX9l4B1Q.text: Came here with friends and family for a birthday party on Sunday and really liked it! This is my third time here and it just gets better and better each time. I wish that I was a little bit more hungry as I just ended up getting the albondigas soup. The soup was good and came with a side of lemons and tortillas, but I wish that they gave you a little bit more as it just came with three meatballs and a little bit of rice. It was not the best albondigas I ever had, but it was good. I ended up adding some of their amazing guacamole, sour cream, and salsa to the soup to make the soup a little bit thicker. Unfortunately the soup was a little thin and greasy, but again once you add some sides it makes up for the lack of thinness.   Our waitress was very nice and attentive to our needs. Our salsa, chips, and water were constantly refilled and I felt appreciated that I was there. Speaking of the salsa I loved the house salsa that came with our chips. It was full of flavor and had just enough heat to open up my senses. One of my friends ordered their chunky salsa, which costs $1, and you could see the chunks of tomato and peppers--very good, but sucks that you have to spend $1 for a small cup.  I checked out my friends food, which was a mix of tacos, chimichangas, burritos, refried beans, and taco salads--all which I sampled and were great. I just think next time I will come with a bigger appetite and try one of those entrees. I would come at a different time as the wait was a little long, but worth it. I will be back when I am in Phoenix.

HIwCiQWDrlQHu_Ctc6u7pQ.text: The food was delicious! Everything was great from the salsa to my main dish which was the pollo fundido with extra jalapeno sauce. I recommend you ask to be seated at the cantina side as it has a great atmosphere, and even if you don't drink you will enjoy the music.

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. With my sister. Lola at the Cantina side of the restaurant which has a great atmosphere.

TfBq4ynVyqwLK1lqxy9ZJQ.text: The food is alright.. Their take out service is terrible. 1, the restaurant menu is not the same as their take out menu.  2, the setup for pick up is like a cheap fast food walk up window.  3, the cashiers are rude.  Check Comedor Guadalajara . Much better place.

CS59FYZkBOTH5ujE3cIqNA.text: I just wanted to make a comment and a recommendation. Every time I order take out, the packaging is the worst. Beans are very hot and put in a Styrofoam cup with a very thin lid that melts due to the heat and the beans are always all over the place = huge mess. They also put the hot sauce in the same cups and your lucky of the lid is on snug most times the chili spills all over the bag. I would hope that they would invest in some better quality to go paper goods. Food is always great the 1 star review is due to the to go containers.

-o3dlUwr0wIoUr2v8nHPPQ.text: ordered carne asada and the meat was tough. brother ordered chicken chile relleno but it was not a large poblano pepper just more like a breaded egg coating, disappointed! place was cramped for room and too hot.

jeV8W0LzXuH5-4xNG7n7hg.text: I used to come here once a week, sometimes more, i always get four tacos and albondigas soup. Slowly but surely every time it got worse. A few months ago there albondigas tasted like BBQ sauce... ew that is not how it is supposed to taste.. and yesterday I was hoping everything would get better.. but when my boyfriend opened our albondigas.. there was no soup/ juice. It was just rice and meat. No broth or anything.. it was really salty and they were really hard to cut through.  And they also changed the size of their hot sauce.. so now it's even tinier and they still don't give you enough. I don't think I will be returning..

D-H0m9RD5POhiDdb85h4Ug.text: Can't go wrong with food consistency, could update the place after all of these years. Wonderful margaritas and tortillas. I always get the Red Burrito. The bar has always had a nice vibe, never really enjoy any other area.

h5AnBXx3QeCniLHh4IS5-g.text: The food here was so good my wife and I overate to the point that we can't even drive away because we both are scared we're gonna vomit. Will be back. So good.

1fhSMbyVLt9EcnMmMsVALA.text: I came here with a friend for lunch. I got two things a-la carte: the beef tamale and chicken enchilada because I love them both and there was not a combo for both items. I had the red and green sauces on the side. The tamale was alright. It came out of the husk which made the outside a little drier than usual. The enchilada was better of the two in my opinion. And I actually like the salsa that came with the chips better than the red or green sauce - go figure. Also, the large margarita is a good size. It was much bigger than I expected.   Service was quick and friendly. And the prices were soo cheap.   I might come back and try some more things because my friend that I came with raved about the cheese crisp and burittos...and Bill Clinton visited too!

JDsrwLAulaqO2J6ew4R-yQ.text: This has been my families go to restaurant for over 30 years. I love so so so much love it. Everything  is amazing drinks & food.  We come from South Chandler and it's worth the drive.  The prices are unbeatable.

pgl22PWpFTXZGgLNOL0eEA.text: Was So Good, We Ate To Much.  Every now and then I find myself at Ponchos Mexican Food to satisfy my  burrito cravings.  The only problem I encounter when I go to Ponchos is the food is so good I eat too much.  On this visit my lunch companions and I  started with the nachos and chipotle chicken.  The nachos were delicious  and we could have stopped there, but we didn't and ordered our entree's.    My lunch companions ordered the Carne Asada Burrito, Carnitas Fritas, El Crudo Burro, and I had the Pollo Fundido.  The Pollo Fundido, was a wonderfully flavored, deep fried Chimichunga, with Jalapeno Cream Cheese on top. The chicken was tender and moist, the tortilla was crisp, and the Fundido sauce was perfect.  My lunch companion said his El Crudo Burro was delicious as well.  The machaca beef was lean, tender, combined with a light tomatillo sauce. The burrito is topped with red enchilada sauce and melted cheese, and  served with rice.  I think on my next visit I will have to give it a try.  The service at Pancho's is always great. Our drinks were always refilled and we were offered a take out drink as we left.   If you're ever in the area and craving good Mexican Food give Pancho's a try.

_RDFzkrvRw75DltQI0yHAg.text: A Phoenix Native friend introduced me to this local gem years ago. So I've been a loyal customer to this awesome, amazing establishment for almost 10 years to date. The food is always out of sight, delicious, fresh and always on point. The prices are very reasonable and one definitely gets what you pay for. No matter what you order from their extensive menu, I don't believe you can go wrong. My ultimate fave at this place is the Pollo Fundido! The picture in my post does not do it justice . The white jalapeno sauce is to die for and illuminates my taste buds . It can get very crowded at times but it is definitely worth the wait. I have yet to have a bad experience with the food or customer service. If there is any "complaint" I have about this restaurant it's that it can get a bit loud with the crowds that are present at times. But, if you don't mind a lively establishment to enjoy tasty Mexican food, then definitely check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yjRzDlzlzOAULnOky6kYIg.text: We went on a Tuesday night so it wasn't very full, the AC was up high and the lovely waitress turned it down for me.  My cousin had the burrito and the rest of us had the chimichangas.  We had pitchers of margaritas, too.  I could not move afterwards. I didn't get the full meal with the sides, just the chimichanga and even then we were in such pain because we ate so much, we had to go home. So, it's a lot of food.  It was really yummy. The margaritas are yummy, too, they do not taste very strong, though.  Overall, it was a good experience, minus the pain from eating too much afterward. I suggest NOT eating too many of the nachos they bring out beforehand.

VGc9oZRh9XAoZyLl_VJP5Q.text: Been going here since I was a kid in the 90's. Food is still great but service is crap. All young kids waitering and it takes 20 minutes to get a beverage yet alone some silverware.

UqgtLkUFLiusmKES-p5s5g.text: Haven't been here in awhile because of poor customer service and inconsistent quality of food. We were in the area so we decided to give it another try. Let me say first that I've been here numerous times for lack of knowing anything else and because of loyalty. We grew up eating here with parents and grandparents. This was always our go to place. The waitress this trip was nonetheless unaccommodating when placing our order. That's also a reason why we stopped going in the first place. She ended up getting it wrong but, we didn't want to wait for them to get it right. I always order the Pollo Fundido and it was delicious. This was actually the first time I remember it being hot. The only reason I give 3 stars is because of poor customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pollo Fundido smothered in jalapeño cream cheese sauce Muy delicioso
Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Presidents platter

YhRGwNd_0bTUD_TCDmOe6Q.text: Well, I have been coming for any years. I don't live in Phoenix anymore but it is tradition to come to Ponchos every time we visit our family. Today we had an issue with a food item. Katie D our server along with the manager adjusted their policy to make us happy, Great restaurant, great service, great prices

4lZfBFwuMDibf8uzxSqv-Q.text: Exploring new places close to our home. Decided to take in this Mexican restaurant that look like it was always busy. We came through the back which basically was the bar entrance and had to walk through the restaurant which was divided into sections and we had a hard time finding the front entrance. When I found the front entrance it was a small crowded hallway with a bench seat provided. We got seated within 10 minutes even though the host told another couple that it was going to be 20 minutes. That couple stepped outside and lost their place in line. The atmosphere of the seating arrangements were either bench seats or chairs. I ordered the pollo fundido which when I bit into it was excellent but after a while the chicken taste like it was from a can. The waitress was pretty good about filling our drinks but never asked me if I wanted another wine. I would definitely go back to this place to try other foods.

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jOUaijWSa_KuRyMt9FJ3dw.text: Okay listen I'm updating my review and it is with sadness that I report that I will never come here again. The quality of service is just so absolutely terrible. The food is nothing short of fantastic, if you ever receive it. They are painfully understaffed 365 days per year and completely unapologetic about it. The fact that any restaurant thinks that it is okay to never refill drinks, get every order wrong, make you wait 45 minutes to get your check, ask for go boxes but never receive them, is just criminal.  I hate that this place makes me so mad because it has such potential. Goodbye old friend.

jGTBXO23uPBDRAqQl0evBg.text: Good service, good authentic tasting food, good prices and environment. Go check it out! "Popular for Bill Clinton's visit". lol

f5NxJQEqm_qW0iwS9-VpBw.text: Love this place! The food is delicious. The salsa is fantastic and better yet, they sell it. Took home a pint and plenty of left overs. Knocking one star off because service can be extremely slow at times.

6NIZwTN22_71Dmdeh7DSCQ.text: AMAZING mexican food!  i am no fan whatsoever of mexican food...BUT i AM a major fan of Don Poncho's mexican food...specifically their carnitas and asada tacos and sopes...i can only speak for these two items.  And i will keep on coming back for them!  delicious!

DA2AinDaWY9TXahLBquFbg.text: Hmmmm....didn't really impress me when i heard former President Clinton ate here in a whim on one of his trips in PHX. i was more distracted by this eatery being centrally located on a grimey street as well as the odd smell that greeted us in the narrow halls of the waiting area. It surprised me that the odd smell did not deter the number of people who were dining here. There was a brief wait time as this small eatery was packed in every room-including the bar's dining area. There was also a wait for the takeout line which they had conveniently outside...must be something worth yelping about.... So i decided to order what my cousin has been raving about-the chimichangas. I've eaten many a chimichangas before but never...a beef chimichanga... even with its regular guacamole +sour cream combo ever touched the one i had at Ponchos! Simply stated-the overall meal came fast, FRESH & was filling. Now i understand how certain foods can trigger a massive release of endorphins throughout your body....i stuffed myself enough to put me in a food coma. Now i understand that i could never go back to a 'chain' Mexican restaurant again. Affordable as is delicious-Ponchos proves that QUALITY of food isn't necessarily determined by price-as some of the best & most authentic cuisines are truly hidden treasures in local neighborhoods waiting to be found...thank you cousin for helping me discover this gem! The menu may look very typical (ponchosaz.com/eimenu) but you'd only know the taste difference if you ate here & experienced it for yourself. Poncho's wont disappoint.

jIMN8o-Dnj68UnCOWZ2sdA.text: I've found my new home! If your like me and you are drawn to places that are a mix of color, character, funk and a touch of danger, this is the place!  I've driven by numerous times, I didn't even know if was a sit down restaurant, because I always say a line of people ordering from the takeout window at the front. Craving some good mex food, I was going to hit up one of my regular places, but decided to try somewhere real close, and ponchos came up.. Walked past the line of large parties waiting to get in, they had some tables for one in the back. I walked past a very eclectic mix of people, bikers, couples, tourists, and what seemed to be a lot of regulars. The atmosphere, decor, smells and sounds transport me to a place of sheer happiness. The Food: I probably could have been served a tv dinner and still loved this place... Chips and a full bottle of salsa appeared seconds after I sat down. It took me 4 bites to decide that I liked the peppery salsa, but by the end of my meal, only a half inch remained, I realize this may be something I will crave if I ever have to go more than a few weeks without.  For my main, I chose the pollo fundido, as it seems that is the go to dish here. It really was fantastic. Not complicated, greasy, or light, just simply delicious!  For a beverage, I had a small margarita, which had no price, listed. When info the bill it was only $4.00 which was a nice surprise.  After cleaning my plate, I just wanted to sit back and enjoy the vibe, listen to the ranchero music, and pretend I was an actor in a Tarantino/Rodriguez movie.  So if your in town on a smoldering saturday night, you'll likely find me here indulging a neon green bowl o happiness and an empty bottle of salsa.

irurue6qu8YhYfrRyWAIjQ.text: Love this place. Comfy, friendly and great food. The way Mexican restaurants used to be.  No pico de gallo here.  Good rich and smooth salsa with a nice bite. Hot chips, as much as you want. Everything I have tried is way above average. Try it you will like it.

9qKkPXHYc8O7M2hLFcwWaQ.text: Poncho's....WOW! This place is soooo good! I love it...If it's good enough for President's to come eat here, it's good enough for me! You better come hungry though, because the portions are huge..I always have to get a to go box followed by a food coma...

2z1btgpMLBhYHYyfz4gLaQ.text: I love this place and drive about 20 miles just to eat here it has great food and great places. I always get the pollo fundidio and it is delicious every time. I have been going here for about 10 years.

ROHPa1bpW--wj9FR1IUvpQ.text: Best straight-up sit-down Mexican restaurant in Phoenix!  I've driven over 40 minutes on several occasions just to eat here.  This place is really tiny, but that's because it used to be a residence.  Eventually the business grew so much that the owners moved out and converted their home into a restaurant.  The food is great, and really inexpensive.  Everything I've had is excellent.  The staff is friendly and the service is fast.  It's one of the places I like to take visiting friends and family.

ySNKFjqd_edN9xrfNKRp1A.text: You had me at hello. You had me at hello...  For me (and my dad), I am all about first impressions, and if you have bad salsa than I am not likely going to return. Or if you make me PAY for my chips and salsa--FAIL!  Pancho's salsa rocks the house!   Their food is great and call me crazy, but I like eating in their seedy bar.   Their frozen margs arent too bad either.  If you want authenticity--this is the place!

6bZ_yrKXh_CV3lI5bxgiOQ.text: I love Poncho's. I grew up in South Phoenix so my family and I came here all the time when I was a kid and I continue to make the drive back here years later and always bring new friends to try the place out. My favorite dish is the Pollo Fundido. It's so good. The salsa in a squeeze bottle is kinda weird, but good.   Be sure to check out the room with a mural of ex-Pres. Clinton sitting at the end of your table. And the secret service standing on the opposite wall.

fZOHJEB5zR4Q7pHcfWFB9Q.text: Ate dinner here again,and as expected the bomb!!! If you like mexican food go to ponchos the pollo fundido is to die for!!  The service is awesome.

R2aNGgMXOiTxiitFFUa7QA.text: Just went here with the hubby because the yelpers said it was awesome. I ordered the pollo fundido and it was awesome! I have never had it before so maybe I am looking for the wrong thing because I dont have anything to base it off of. I scarfed it down. it was amazing!   Hunny got two beef tamales. I was disappointed by them. They were just pulled beef in a corn tortilla, not wrapped in the corn meal and husk. He scarfed them down anyway though (he doesn't know he was cheated).  We will definitely go back, when we can fork up the money. It was a little pricey for the quality of the tamales but other than that it was great.

8xjzEpO4fl7FFL5dechOJQ.text: Great food and selection. Highly recommend for those looking for a nice family type establishment. This is a great place to take out of town guests who are interested in trying some good Mexican food.  The restaurant gets crowded and there is often a wait but it's worth it for the experience and the food. Be sure to go in the right door or it's a bit confusing.

F0kiE1zCGSQI4IqxTedwlw.text: Ew to poor service and less than desireable food!  No bueno

BkspoocN7X0LxkAhhjb1Lw.text: went after reading positive reviews and craving authentic mexican food. BUT this was HORRIBLE. Staples like chips and salsa were stale and bland respectively. But to make matters worse, my fajita was the most disgusting thing ever. The chicken was fried to the point that I could not chew it, and the veggies were covered in grease, and the whole thing was cooked in Soy Sauce! Is that traditional?? It was a nasty overall experience...

4Ciq6U9OQPMKtVx1hEfOKg.text: It's exactly what I'd expect for an old school Mexican food place. Yeah, it's cramped a little. It's old. The food is the best Mexican food for white people in Phoenix. The hot sauce is to die for. Chips and fresh and endless. I love the gringo Fundito. If you're thinking about eating at this place, stop thinking and start getting down there to get a seat. It can get crowded very quickly. End of story.

_4eBJgC7G6RGM_HI1GJg6w.text: I really have to say that my experience was just okay.  I walked in the wrong way and got ovewhelmed.  There are 2 doors, one is for the bar and one for the restaurant.  Because it was so crowded everywhere we couldn't figure out what door we needed to enter.  We finally got inside and seated in the presidential room.    The doorways and rooms are so tight and clausterphobic.  Everytime I needed something I would have to flag down the waitress and I felt like we were bugging her.  The food was just okay.  I ordered the veggie burrito that I liked but would just get it from the take out window next time where it is even cheaper than inside the restaurant.

bHvTs6b52Rn2wWrxvLJisw.text: Ponchos is an average to good place to get take out or eat in Mexican-AMERICAN food. That is to say It is fried, topped with cheese, and not to complex. The prices are good and the service is fast and because of this is a staple in South Phoenix.

-HyJzP4muvUJUn1ebRO7YQ.text: One of the BEST mexican food in the valley. Beans are the BEST. Enchilada's and folded Tacos are very good. Pollo Fundido is very very tasty. I usually stick to my usual routine: the "Muchas Cosas" plate: cheese enchilada, folded taco (i always get beef), bean tostada, beans, rice & a flower tortilla. You can't beat it. I really like this place, although it can get very busy and customer service can be hit or miss, but overall they are all pretty friendly and helpful. My only complaint, not really a complaint, just a preference, is that I love the FLAVOR of the salsa, but prefer chunkier salsa w/ fresh cilantro. But the salsa they have is GREAT in folded tacos. The chips are good, but i prefer thicker chips, but again, thats just a preference.  They are ALWAYS busy, so get there early (or wait til later to go). They have a take-out window if your in a hurry. Don't even worry about the neighborhood. We just moved near south Phoenix from Chandler, and its fine. The ambiance inside is awesome and the hostess is normally very friendly.   You just can't go wrong here. A++++ food!

3Ay4FKwLPSA1uYAgiS6q5Q.text: Been going here since I was 8 yrs old just recently took my wife and 15 yr old son this last Friday night for dinner . well the waitress we  had looked like she had a few drinks her self we ate dinner then when it came to pay my wife noticed that are waitress had added  a picther of beer to are bill which we never ordered . then when my wife asked her about the pitcher she left to the register with out saying anything like just a moment please or something . very rude I think and then when she came back the bill was more then when the pitcher was added the first time . so we asked to  talk to the manager and when we did the manager sounded like she didn't want to hear about what we had to say not very good customer service . for now on we are just going to start going to the mesquite restaurant , and El trunke restaurant sorry ponchos you guys just lost a loyal customers and we will let are family and friends know. We loved the service they use to have especially the little old lady that always greeted when you came into register check in . we didn't even want to put one star up but I guess you have to so you can write a review

8GdJnilLRTlkVTIPo94kOQ.text: Place is pretty good, small Beer selection for having a large Bar. I have one special request Poncho, Modelo Especial!

kPDRtURmqrPoyKXq48Dd0Q.text: My favorite mexican food restaraunt.  The #4 lunch is the awesome, red or green burro enchilada style, rice and beans.  Good chips n salsa too. The pancho villa burro is good also.  My mom is a picky eater but ate her whole burrito when i took her.

ihEncKdjLMCOOqru0rK9ag.text: Authentic mexican food.  This is a long time family spot and I continue to go there whenever I feel like I need a great taco, rice and beans.  Never had a bad service in almost two decades of going there.  Could not recommend enough.

ugUebdHeQrgoAuiRZxRTbQ.text: Don't expect quick service, but you can't go wrong with the shredded beef tacos and the pollo fundido. They are exceptionally delicious. I get weekly cravings for this place. Their bottled sarsaparilla (root beer) is so good too.

3LQb2JCuoajGiOlB1e9N0Q.text: I love this place. I recommend it all the time.   However, I always....and I mean ALWAYS have to explain to people that this is "not the place with the little flag that gets you more tacos"   This restaurant has a special place in my heart.

wIUKgHi-CWJPPJBnChoAJQ.text: Been going here since I was a little girl. Always always good. Get the albondigas soup!

_jr1yD-hzpNyREsxOMK4xg.text: Worst customer service i have ever had... for starters a group of 7 met down there for a birthday dinner. 2 of us showed up a little after everyone else did it took our waitress 20 mins to ask me for my drink order because she never passed our table again after serving beverages to the others at our table. Then 20 mins after getting my drink she came and asked us if we were getting food. A couple of us said yes we are all getting food. She then continued to wave her hands in a circular "come on" motion. For what we took as a hurry up lets get this over with. So instead of going in an order we each just startes telling her our order. (Needing a refill by this point) she then precedes to take everyone elses order then walked away (still needing a refill) 30 mins later she brought us our food. We all ate (still needing a refill ) didnt bother to ask for a 3rd time for another drink. I asked for my check. 30 mins later i asked the manager of the bar i belive her name was Lisa. To get our checks she brings them back and they had things on them other people at the table ordered (if she would have went around the table  instead of a russian rullet style this would not have happened) i get my bill. I ordered 1 soda (free refills i did not recieve) and a dinner plate. On that bill was a gratuity of 8.00 i was pissed i was not going to tip her and when i asked why it was on there she smirked saying "partys of 6 or more is automatic " i told her she did not deserve thia tip at all and she said "oh well" .... tipping is for service. I did not receive 8.00 worth of service. So she took it as it was a for sure tip she didnt have to give good service being she would be tipped either way. I will NEVER go back nor will i tell people about this place. WORST EVER CUSTOMER SERVICE!

xvd-6AcMHQkGnJx_MYhE6Q.text: Love Love Love this place.  Authentic Mexican food.  I had the beef tacos and beef tamale plate with rice and beans!  So yummy.  Highly recommend

LP4SFjKBddjwhg71V3vtEw.text: Even though there are not too many authentic Mexican food restaurants Poncho's Mexican Food has to be the most memorable! This is a restaurant is located near south phoenix and the exterior is very creative and has the feel of a home. The interior is about the same as the outside because the restaurant was originally a home. I really enjoyed the food it was filled with various flavors, the serving size was perfect even though I had some left overs. The service was okay because our food took a while to come out and we rarely saw the waitress. However the food was well worth the wait, I would recommend trying it at least once because the food is not something a person should not miss.

ytNtQmYa9MQBI3WOTPIT_g.text: Quick getting seated. Friendly staff. The food came out so fast and it was delicious. I got the pollo fondito, which is supposedly "everyone's favorite" but I have to be honest, it was good but not the best. My fiance got the el crudo and it was great! I'll definitely be coming back to try other dishes, though!

UASmxaLCOdHR5PzYh9O9aQ.text: So good here.  So good.  I asked my friend who lives in Phoenix what's a place that is "Phoenix" and I can't eat anywhere else.  She recommended Poncho's and man, I am glad she did.  I had already eaten a bag of Ruffles sour cream and cheddar, so my stomach wasn't feeling that great.  But I had to get the pollo fundido, and it was amazing.  It was pretty big.  Ok, enough about that, just know, it was amazing.  I am salivating thinking about it.  The chips and salsa was great.  Everything was great.  Go here for some authentic Mexican food.  Yum.

QvEAKKed1s37p5mLsTKyRw.text: Their 3 way chimichangas are to die for. I was talking to a friend about mexican food. I said there is only one mexican food restaurant that I will eat at. Their food is authentic. He said let's try it and it better be good. We get there for lunch and is full as usual. We ordered 2 3 way chimichangas to go. He sat in his car and said let me try it before we leave. He tasted it and he said wow this is pretty good. I live like 10 min away. He kept it on his lap and could not stop eating it at stop lights. By the time we got to my house his plate was gone. I have been going to Ponchos for a couple of decades and that is the only mexican restaurant I will eat at. I normally go out to eat alot of italian and sushi but Ponchos will always draw me back. You have to try their 3 way chimichangas when you go there.

bJbLmsySXimzS2ne_MAT0A.text: Love this place.  Every time we make the trip from Tucson to Phoenix I get this craving for Poncho's.  The building must have been an old house from the 1930's and converted into a restaurant.  There are so many nooks and crannys to get lost in.  But when you make your way in you are greeted by this lovely older lady who is full of piss and vinegar with a great sense of humor who leads you to your table.  We were there Sat. at about 2.00PM.  The place was packed with large families who seem to know the wait staff pretty well.  Everyone is so friendly and efficient which is a plus. Now to the real test.  The food is wonderful, rich in flavor and beautifully  presented.  Unfortunately, I am a wuss and order the same gringo dish (Chicken Enchilladas with green sauce)  Hubby orders Chile Relleno, tamale, combo plate.  The thing is those onions which are sauteed to perfection slathered all over the dish including the rice. This makes me real happy.  If you love onions this is surely the place.  It's a "must go" when heading up to Phoenix.

JkrVRGuGAKANErlNRIWtLg.text: Came back again with the same person insisting the place was great.   I avoided the single flauta meal ($7 for a flauta with beans and rice), and got a #7 (chile relleno, rice, beans, and a flour tortilla) instead. No regrets.   The food was great this time around, and despite being a really packed night, our waitress tonight was very attentive. She frequently brought refills and more chips and was prompt in clearing plates and bringing the bill.   Left full and satisfied this time.   It was probably just a bad combination of bad server and disappointing food last time that led to the poor rating, but I'd definitely recommend the place now.

tXVSyBaVdbf-2z4_evpTAg.text: I call this... "Ode To The Only Resturant I Truely Love"  My parents went to school with the owner's kids. They remember when it was a walk-up window take out place. Infact, when my father picked my mother and I up from the hospital after I was born, the FIRST stop they made on the way back to the rez was Poncho's!   One of the co-owners likes to laugh and say that she saw me before most of my family did! I went from being in a car seat gurgling as my relatives chomped on the best chips in town served with some awesome hot sauce that hasn't really changed since I was young. To being a little girl who always ordered the deep friend tortilla wrapped hot dogs with crinkle cut french fries and the BEST coldest ketchup I ever had!! To being a young woman who brought every single close friend I met while being away at school or through the native pageant circuit to enjoy the wonders that is "The Works".   My FAVORITE meal there is the cheese crisp as an appetizer, Combination #18 which is two tacos (i always order beef!), rice & beans. They have the best beans EVER!! And the rice is awesome too! I've had all the desserts on their menu and nothing really jumps out at me. I guess I still love the family tradition of going to the water & ice cream shop for thrifty ice cream before heading home!   I have had many experiences at this resturant. I've held my high school graduation party there; this resturant was the place where I signed a contract that made me the goodwill ambassador of my people for nearly a year; it was from their bar that I had my first LEGAL margarita on my 21st birthday, it was also the place where my then boyfriend got on one knee and asked me to marry him, and it was their waitresses who said "to HELL with him!!" when we ended our engagement.   It's a wonderful place to me, I like that I can go in and say "Hi Marty!" to their one time waitress who now manages the resturant. and have her yell, "HI CHERYL!!" Yes... that's right!! That's how long she has known me!! She can call me Cheryl and get away with it!! I also love the other long time co-owners/managers. There is one that always wants to buy a certain piece of jewelry off of me. And another who always laughes when I bring someone new in.   Poncho's is a place of regulars... LONG time regulars. and i think this is what every great restuant needs. Local, long time regulars who grow with the restuant. Who bring in new friends to enjoy the huge wonderful chimichangas or the Presidential Special and laugh over delicious enchiladas while a secret service agent (who kinda looks like leslie nealson if u ask me) painted on the wall watches on. While a bustling resturant does what it does best: offer homestyled, friendly, affordable and great food to it's old time regulars and it's about-to-become regulars.

mMY9RwVJSLUhdD6rAO7wPg.text: I think this building was a house before they turned it into a restaurant because the halls are a bit narrow and the rooms are a bit small, but the food is great! They give you chips and salsa while you are waiting for your food and their salsa is home made and delicious! Their margaritas are amazing and huge (if you get the large) and pretty strong ;) . I wouldn't suggest you don't go on a Friday night for dinner because they do get pretty busy and the wait gets pretty long.

Ng6kvFFI2Xfxrhnbe5nlxg.text: The service isnt amazing, but its the best Mexican food in the world. Just my opinion but its good old Sonoran style cooking and I just love it.  Their hot sauce, rice and beans are second to none.  Theres really nothing bad on the menu, only bad for you.  It is one of my favorite places ever.

nbPAuW6iM3rddcVLFQkLhw.text: There is a reason this was the place picked by President Clinton on his trip to Phoenix. The food is authentic. I recommend the pollo fundito. I would caution travelers. The ambiance is second rate and the neighborhood is quite sketchy. Definitely a day visit place.  Lines get long after five and the weekends.

C-alhUZiibl9aukfgSOnDg.text: I have been going to Ponchos for at least twenty years and I am always satisfied.  The food is heavy - the way Mexican food should be.  You cannot go wrong with the chimichangas, Mexican pizza, green chili or flautas.    A few years ago during a trip to Phoenix, President Clinton came into Ponchos.  They commemorated the event with a mural on the wall where Clinton sat.  Also the chips and salsa are bottomless and fantastic!

neO8Vqt8Wh2f96JA1sNNrQ.text: My wife is a die hard but that's because she grew up eating here. I can say this is not a bad place for food. They make a good everything.   We had  2x 3 way burrito green chili, red chili and bean with green sauce on top.  1x Pollo fundito with rice (excellent) A ton of chips and salsa  The bill was slightly over $20...lol freaking MCD'S is more.

m-T5i_dDrSbU1Tjz8ZW_TQ.text: This place is ridiculous, service is no good, food is not authentic, the price was outrageous just not a good experience at all i will not be going back...

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-Gv96Zx3l6cOxbleiUn55A.text: They need to do better at dish washing, I get a dirty salsa bowl almost every time. Many times they bring the salsa bowl out with the salsa bottle (like a ketchup bottle) sitting inside the bowl, so the bottom of the bottle is inside the bowl after it's probably been placed down on numerous tables all day long, touched by everyone's hands, dropped on the floor, who knows, kinda gross. They also love to sweep their carpeted floors next to your table while you're eating so everyone's dirty boot dust becomes airborne and settles in your drinks and on your plate, again, kinda gross. The food is ok, kind of salty sometimes, and my husband ordered the chile relleno once and it was the size of a pepperoncini so I'd recommend ordering something else. Their red chile is amazing, the best I've had at any Mexican restaurant.

21WvVdwYQAgMQF3H2UzPCw.text: So stupid, how can you not get a kid a meal at the window but you can get one inside. Way to go ponchos!

nJa2llkSYGGQBV4p9efaNg.text: I have been going to Ponchos since the 1980's, it's one of my all three time favorites, I always order the three things I go there for because as a Latina I just love Mexican food. The Green chile corn enchilada can only be described as perfection every time the sauce is mild but tangy and the corn tortilla is fried to tender perfection in harmony with the cheese. The Chile Relleno is my favorite out ofGarcia's, Macayo's and Popo's  the chile is stuffed with I'm thinking a couple of different cheeses or a perfectly mild longhorn or cheddar, I think Longhorn. The chile is dipped into the scrambled egg whites and and fried to a crispy but fluffy indulgence. The green corn chile tamale which is usually a firm masa with green chiles and cheese was unfortunately runny as if it had been sitting in the chile sauce for a while. I believe it was a fluke, we went on a very busy Saturday night so that's what probably happened. The waiter was so fast and attentive bringing the chips and Margaritas quickly and kept asking if everything was ok. I will continue coming here for the rest of my life and I hope that you all will come to call it your favorite as well .

_EShB0gZ1u8FKAXdqEagqQ.text: The food is pretty good and I consider it to be authentic. The chips and salsa are addicting! Ponchos loses two stars because the service is always very bad.  I have gone to Ponchos several times for several years so I know what to expect...poor service! My friends and I went today and the service we received from the waitress was no different than prior visits...poor! However, Louie should have been our waiter! He is actually the busboy and was more helpful than our waitress!! Louie took very good care of us...very simple requests our waitress didn't even come around to ask, more napkins, chips and one refill on our drinks.  So my friends and I agree....ASK FOR LOUIE!!!!

eIif1l9Od0t_ojWgvpQ0Gg.text: What a gem. This place might need an external makeover but don't judge it based on that! We had some reasonable margaritas to start. They offer complimentary chips and salsa. The salsa is super addicting!! The chips are warm and taste fresh. I ordered the green chilli burrito with beef and it was so yummy! You can get rice and beans as a side if you wish but the burrito was plenty of food for me. It comes with guacamole and sour cream on the side. Delicious! There were several things on the menu I was interested in trying. Now looking at yelp, the pollo fundido is definitely on my list when we go next. Probably a new regular spot for my parents and I. Also, I will add that the prices are very reasonable. Check this place out. Bill Clinton approves.

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green chili beef burro mmmmm

f49j02trOMhqUaujey83jw.text: Interior was cute and design was nice . Got a poncho vila- not a big fan of it but overall great experience .

D0-hEHXJV39eXBY-hZ89IQ.text: My mom heard about this place from her coworkers so we drove out from Gilbert to give it a try. Definitely one of the places with the worst service. The staff is rude. Especially our waitress who seemed very annoyed and wasn't friendly. The fact that she wouldn't swing by to ask if we were doing ok or to refill the drinks upset us more. We didn't even get a thank you.

F1tuP_cZ0HUUU-7Hk7ZIYQ.text: I love ordering this for pick up. Very authentic feel, and if you actually dine in it's entertainment/people watching. You pick your food up at an outside counter which is very cute. The food has always been good. Best tacos even to.go! They put them in a separate wrapper. Fresh crunchy shell and moist shredded beef. Yum!

bBZb16NukqyV1OORbrxWuQ.text: This place is still as good as it used to be way back in the day! Poncho's has that real and authentic Mexican food. All of their items are delicious, and I do mean all of them. Please do yourself a favor and eat at Poncho's, you will not regret it. Oh, and their red salsa is muy delicioso! Prices are more than reasonable for the quality of the food that is served. Also, expect to wait a bit for a table on popular nights such as Friday & Saturday. But the food is definitely worth the wait.

3VUK3QDb6Vh_gBkO6VgUAw.text: The food was good. The salsa and chips were freshly made. My plate was served. With beans and cheese just the way I like it. The server was very nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. That&#39;s a jukebox.
Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good chips and salsa

h6Kz3VGQJwTjz9GDzCSuvg.text: Food tasted horrible rice was hard burrito was gross had no flavor only good was the chips and salsa service could have been better waitress only came around twice will stick to my go to place Rositas place on 24th and McDowell

0mtBQruUX1D18eVvz-F2Kw.text: Came in for lunch and put in my food order along with my drink order after waiting 40 minuets I ask to get my food to go and asked to speak with a manger. After another 10 minuets the manager comes out and says she will take the drinks off my order. I was told it took additional 10 minutes because they had to box it up so basically my fault it took longer. Manager refused to take food off our bill and only offered to remove drinks so after all that I left without my food. No apologies given by management only excuses.

1aOwmmqvgtkiZ7a6UQJJWA.text: Honest Mexican restaurant. Extensive menu, never been disappointed. Although I usually opt for the Poncho Villa. There is a mural of Bill Clinton, he dined here when he was president. Ladies still like to take their picture at the Clinton table. (Actually, under it)! Excellent party platters at a good price. Only drawback, it's getting harder to pop in for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Slick Willie&#34;

Jvq0Z28OaVwG4S3XvJHQcw.text: Huge portions of delicious authentic Mexican food at reasonable prices. Great service. The red chili and carne asada were exceptional! Restaurant has small rooms decorated in Mexican motif. Luncheon specials.

iQaTyNUM2Kn6t4IBWJtxtA.text: The food is good but if you have children like do, take little as possible inside! I have infant twins with a toddler and Thank God they sat my husband and I with the kiddos of course in a small dining room. It would have been a struggle anywhere else.  The food was good...I had a chimichanga which was decent just not as crisp as it used to be. It was like a wet burrito which are yummy as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chimichanga...yummy!!

93pUhLsDWyAojBKbUu0VYw.text: This is one of the best Mexican restaurants in Phoenix. The chips and salsa to start are fantastic and the Pollo Fundido is insanely good

JSjez_uthx6HrP7vzYKJqw.text: Time for an update. We've been to Poncho's about five times now. The only disappointment was when we did the take-out window: got several tacos that were way over cooked.   Tonight we arrived at 6:10 PM on a Wednesday. They had four parties in line, as usual. We waited 12 mins.   My wife ordered #18 which was two Shredded Beef Tacos, beans and rice. I ordered #11, a Relleno, Green Chili Corn Tamale and a Cheese Enchilada. We added two margaritas for a $30 tab before tip.   The #18 was very good. The beef had good flavor. The rice and beans: outstanding. I don't know if it's all scratch made but it sure tasted like it was. My #11 was very good. I love onions and the sauce was very heavy with onions. The Tamale was savory and huge. The enchilada was small but I still couldn't finish it. I haven't had a lot of rellenos so I'm not sure how it compared to others.   Our server was attentive on a busy night, so ole there!  Still highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Number 11: Relleno on left, cheese enchilada in center and Tamale on left. Excellent.

atWuhmPwixdvr6jNDzdbGg.text: We went in for lunch on a Saturday. We were seated immediately. Chips and salsa arrived soon after and the waitress took our drink and food order. Food came out hot and timely and was very good. We were in and out in less than 45 mins and for only $27 w/o tip! Great place. Very authentic. Will definitely visit again.

9SZ7DCxHVAfzr3zXwjgV5w.text: I have heard many good things about this place and then saw mixed reviews on Yelp.  Bill Clinton even ate here.  (I don't think George Washington slept here!  You east coasters will get the joke.)  My overall opinion is that Poncho's is a run of the mill Mexican restaurant.  - my server was very nice and attentive (except for refilling my water) but the kitchen was very slow  - the chips were fresh but still very greasy  - the Pollo Fundido, one of their signature entrees was a good sized but soggy chimichanga with lots of moist chicken stuffed inside it.  It was then drowned in a white cream cheese jalapeno sauce.  All very salty to me.  - I ordered rice and beans that we're okay at best.  I know they are refried beans but these were also greasy.  Bottom line - with over 20+ Mexican restaurants within a few miles of here I will continue trying new ones vs returning here.  Sorry Poncho's!

Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips are fresh but a bit greasy.

mfotXBHeHNlpv0XyF2e2tQ.text: To give you an idea of what I thought, I was going to take a picture of my meal... but I ate it first.  I got the Pollo Fundido, which is their signature dish. it was fantastic. It's basically a chicken chimichanga enchilada style. The sauce on that smothers the chimichanga was the most delicious sauce I've ever tasted. I took a bite and couldn't stop eating. It's like they took all that was good in the world and put it in a sauce.   The chips were also very good. In all honesty, the first batch was good but the second batch of chips were a little stale. Still, a must stop for lunch or dinner if you're ever near South Phoenix.  I'm definitely going back.

5sX1UfTPCyXAYpSHo1H8bw.text: If you're looking for a good Mexican food this is the spot! Whether you're looking for take out or dine in, you will not be disappointed. Their chips and salsa is delicious and service is wonderful! I am always impressed when dining  at a restaurant and refills are brought out before my drink is empty. Every time I've dined here I have always gotten refills (without asking) when my drink is half way done. And I mean every time, now that is wonderful service!!! Cost is fair for the large food portion given. Definitely a five star restaurant for great service and wonderful food!

IDvmcvH-YFyhal8ZYmkQeQ.text: This place has really gone downhill.  We went there tonight to celebrate my best friends birthday with some yummy food and margaritas.  We left there 3 hours after having gotten there beyond disappointed.  First they wrote down the wrong name for us so when they called, we didn't say anything and they gave our table away.  We asked them the status an hour after being there and their response was oh well we called you, now you have to wait.  They admitted they just wrote a random name down and didn't even ask us if maybe that was our party. We finally get squeezed into a booth made for 4 people, we have 7 in our party....we didn't fit...shocker.  they got us another table and then took 10 minutes to take our drink order and brought us the wrong drinks. Our server was nowhere to be found and we had to tell one of the bussers to let her know we were ready.  By now we had been there for over 1.5 hours.  She takes our order and disappears again, comes back to take the other tables order and disappears again.  30 mins after that, she brings the other table their appetizer, which happened to be the same as ours, and disappears again.  Never once checking on us, no refills, no chips...nothing.  when she finally comes back with the food, we mention the appetizer and she's less than apologetic and says I guess I can get it for you for free.  Now, after over 2 hours of being there, our party finally getting our meals, she says to me, "oh we don't have what you ordered. It's not my fault but you can get something else if you want".  Horrible. I asked for the manager who decides she will just comp our food instead of coming to talk to me.  I left there, after being there for 3 hours, hungry, upset and frustrated.  I've been going to Ponchos for years but I don't think I will ever go back again.  Shame because I used to love it.

iIPS7r0L7sYbuGx9Pa7XJg.text: Not impressed.   I got the shredded beef chimichanga with red chili for the 1st time, long wait (about 20 min, with only a couple of people waiting) and it was really good.  Went back a second time and was not expressed with the green chili, had to many big pieces of onions in my chimichanga.  I really liked minced onions and these were Not minced.  Maybe they should warn you about the onions!!    The last time we went back the lady at the take out counter was not in a good mood.  we ordered a chimichanga with red chili and a smothered chicken burrito.  She told us it will be 45 minutes.  So we patiently waited for what we hoped was going to be good Mexican food.  45 minutes later we got our food and ordered was all wrong.  She gave us a chicken chimichanga instead of smothered chicken burrito and a plain bean burrito.  We referenced back to our receipt and it was not itemized, no details of what we ordered or what we were charged for.  It took another 30 minutes to have them retake and fix our order and then another 30 minutes to get our food. We waited 1hr 45min.  service was horrible and 8 dollars for a burrito that we waited almost 2 hours to take back home and eat... Will not be driving all the way to south phoenix for Ponchos.

BmLYWatLKwXqe5Gq9BD4IQ.text: Arizona is known for it's amazing foodie gems you can't find anywhere else.  Poncho's is, sadly, not one of them.  Wait! Hear me out. Before you ignore this review, understand that Arizona stands alone when it comes to Mexican food. Having eaten everywhere for Mexican food in both California and New Mexico, I can say that AZ's authenticity and flavor are incomparable. So naturally you would want to make the most of your dining experiences in Arizona and eat at places that have plates that leave a lasting impression on your palette.  Although Poncho's may have a quaint history you want to root for, it doesn't mean that their cooking skills are the kind you want to spend a good amount for. Just because someone says they're Mexican or have a Mexican background does NOT mean that they automatically have the correct method of seasoning, prepping, or even frying.  My boyfriend and I wanted a Sunday lunch there, and we were going in with an open mind. I was actually excited that I would finally try the "pollo fundido" that everyone talked about. We left a little disappointed.  The human traffic in the dining area is distracting. The setup of tables is a little weird, and although the warm paintings of desert landscape are inviting, the constant movement of waitresses, busboys, and families is...well, annoying. Then the food came. It was very, very, VERY inauthentic. The salsa for the chips was literally a tomato paste that resembled something like ketchup with some spices thrown into it. The meal was heavy; it was greasy and felt more like a fast food combo that wouldn't keep me full for too long. Great meals leave you satisfied, but here I couldn't eat much. I looked around and noticed that the crowd that ate at this place really didn't care if the food was bland or nothing close to the beautiful mom and pop shops that would put the food to shame. It was saddening and a little frustrating to know that they were missing out.   "Can I be honest with you?" My boyfriend asked.  "I could get something just like this at Del Taco."  Mr. Clinton, if you come back to Phoenix, I can show you places that would blow your mind.

glTLcansumcpsEeSFwML7Q.text: We have gone to this so called Mexican restaurant. And one time we saw roaches on the wall . everyone that Was sitting in that area . including us we left .

koFPILb-22IT8j0LPZ7Ssw.text: Had to seat ourselves but overall a great experience and the food was fantastic. I will definitely come back. Barbara was our serve. She does a great job!

D5ftJKT4DqvMoUldpMDAlQ.text: Some of the best Mexican food I can find in the Phoenix valley. It also has a great little neighborhood bar in the back of the restaurant. I tried to stop in here at least once every time I am working out here.

TWPnqOvjisUKyhZZVvqMiA.text: I absolutely love the Pollo Fundido. They are super generous with the creamy jalepeno sauce they top it with.  I've been here twice now and the 2nd time I swore I'd try the Chili Relleno but I couldn't resist the Pollo Fundido. Finance was happy with his combo plate both times as well.   Can't beat the house margaritas, they are amazing.   Salsa and guacamole is awesome.   The location is a little questionable and intimidating, that is the only reason for 4 stars.  Food, drinks and service have never been a problem here.   I highly recommend Poncho's, we haven't found a single place that beats it yet.

-6ftShMWbE5zwGUR0vM98g.text: If you want a family night out to Mexican food...this is the place!  Pros: Not too pricey, great amount food for the price, great drink specials (21+), outside quick to-go order window.  Cons: Be prepared for long wait times Thursday-Saturday, small waiting area, no parking, small water cups (you have to keep waiving a waiter down to get a refill)   Overall great spot to take the kids and family

RB5_PMa6ACgs23rGf3nGWQ.text: Always a good experience! The Pollo Fundido is always great! Sounded kinda weird the first time, but the chorizo cheese crisp is a must! Recommend this place to anyone that like a TRUE authentic Mexican restaurant!   P.S. The Albondigas is ALWAYS good on a sick day!

mtwJZf8AskGCkRgGoyiIFA.text: I've been eating here since I was a little girl and not much has changed. The food is really good for the price. Sometimes they have their bad days, chips are stale, salsa taste like straight tomato sauce, but overall the food is yummy.   Some of my favorite dishes include the beef tacos, borracho burro, and the tamale especial. You can't go wrong with those picks. I also have to mention that their michaldas are so good but a bit on the spicy side.   Fridays and Saturday nights get busy so don't be surprised to wait 15-20 minutes for a seat. Ponchos is on the top of my list for favorite restaurants!

qei4Oq4cYmCDJlM52AFk4Q.text: For being a legend I would say that Ponchos is not up to par, nor do they have the best authentic Mexican food in south Phoenix. The albondigas soup that they make is always too salty, and the meatballs are never fully cooked. I've ordered the soup many times in hopes that it will be cooked and they fail every time. I always end up putting my soup in the microwave to completely cook the meatballs. The tacos are extremely greasy, and the restaurant needs renovating. The chips and salsa is about all I will eat. I've been asked by coworkers on where to go for great Mexican food and I always advise them to go to Comedor Guadalajara. Ponchos is NOT the bees knees and I would avoid it. Sorry but they just don't cut it.

YVNaWAJx7AcFOzaZC5LtzQ.text: Food was ok typical Mexican food the atmosphere was busy and it was a little warm inside. It's a small place and they thrive off of Bill Clinton having eaten there. I give it a 3 for food and service. However the margarita was no joke it was strong and tasty. Maybe I am a wimp but it knocked me to the floor.

rrR4Exs0IhrwfD1bwpLOjg.text: The food is good, the restaurant is absurdly filthy.  Disgustingly dirty, slow and uncaring wait staff, you typically get sat next to either a table full of screaming kids, or a group that believes loud profanity leads to stimulating dinner conversation.  My strong suggestion - get your food as takeout. It is a shame this restaurant is operated the way it is. There is absolutely no reason for the third world conditions.

TUp4_HKVBUDp0M-4Y0BKfA.text: For the non-Mexican food lover, you'll find their hamburgers to be adequately sufficient. It's just a Plain Jane type of burger, lettuce and tomatoes. A simple man. Yet, good and filling, it's a burger at a Mexican place. Nachos would be a second choice, but they're really just mini, greasy, delicious  tostadas. I love them! Order the Small - you're not going to be able to finish it, so don't bother ordering the Large. Oooh, almost forgot about a picky kid's choice: a giant cheese crisp! This can also be an appetizer for a large group, just add salsa zigzags all over that biznatch.   Slightly Mexican inclinations? Their lovely,  giant chimichanga is what I set my standards to. It's delicious.   Margaritas are strong and the staff are friendly. Salsa is super spicy and chips crisp.  Grew up here and when I visit Arizona, Poncho's is always a must.

Celgsqn1APszGPoMIBNtow.text: Sunday, and the family wants to go on a picnic. Great. You have a couple of choices.  Feign some sort of non-specific illness so you can sit home and watch Red Zone Channel, or tag along and act like a good parent for a change. You choose the latter.  This was the drill.  I called in a takeout order at Poncho's, picked it up, then drove the entire crew up to Dobbin's Lookout atop South Mountain. (About a 10 minute drive from Poncho's on Central Avenue)  Yup. A seven-mile vertical drive up South Mountain chocked with enough mountain switchbacks to ensure your entire family will be car sick upon arrival, leaving most, if not all of Poncho's feast available for your lunch tomorrow.  Hey, I didn't do this on purpose, things just worked-out in my favor for a change.

WrHvG6VSYBHuCIT3loN2cQ.text: Found 2 roaches on my table within 30 seconds of them bringing my food! Didnt apilogize only remade one plate out of 5 and only took off the cost of out drinks which were maybe in total of $7 never eating there again. Its not even that good of food

INddu5YoHHAOijKVVUHTVg.text: I have been coming to this place since I was a kid.. Overall it is a good place to go when you want amazing addictive salsa!! I always come back for more and can always rely on a good meal when coming here.

98F-NJEgTgYRysflnKUa6A.text: We just left ponchos, haven't been there in about a year the food has gone down, The chicken chimichanga was very salty, the Sonora style enchiladas Patty was very hard couldn't cut it with a knife, The green chili look like slop, the service has gone down.  It was my favorite place to go but not anymore!!

vjso-2lhlap4vuI9IO4QiQ.text: Last night 3 couples went to Panchos for dinner.   My husband and I have been there several times and we highly recommened it.   The other two couples had never been there and will never go back.  We had 3 separate checks and each of us had a coupon.   The waiter came back and informed us that the manger told him only 2 of us couples could use a coupon.   We asked to speak with him.  He came out and had a very flip attitude.   He told us no and when we said we would not be back he shrugged his shoulders and walked away.   This was the worst customer service we have had since moving to Las Vegas 1 1/2 years ago.  Unfortunately I do not remember his name,  but this happened on Saturday February 9, 2019.

w5DQ2GZdoTGf1hsPLOBm-A.text: A Mexican Food Classic in South Mountain Village, Phoenix, AZ. The food is fantastic and I love the location. I have been on a Culinary Journey for some of the best Mexican Food in the Phoenix Area and I think Poncho's is one of the best. The Salsa is a bit different, it's served in a bottle. I was like okay,  but it's actually very satisfying. The Chips are fantastic. I gauge a Mexican restaurant on the basics; rice, beans, chips and salsa. Overall I was pleased. High recommend.

Jw0Mq65K0sOkYBzzq7rUIg.text: Bill Clinton...?. The food's good and no windows perfect for bills mexican fix. He ate here during his trip to Arizona while in office. Even though he swears not to have had any culinary relations with these burritos..... lol

yqITZ0ulJmjpd1mTzAgTIg.text: Not what you would expect this neighborhood. Not really bad, but uninspired. Service was ok. Will try one more time because it is convenient.

b2p-pKZw1hGWwtyWgisl4g.text: How has this place stayed in business for 36 years serving the weirdest, unauthentic Mexican food ever presented on a plate? It might be because Bill Clinton ate here in 1999 and they are still getting food tourists? Not sure, but I did snap a photo of Clinton's table and that earned the extra star. The place is a mishmosh of small rooms and is old looking, but seemingly it retains its customers somehow, The guy next to us said he has been eating here once a week for the past 20 years and the waitress must have been here from day one. Have you ever heard of a waitress being too efficient, doing her job too good - kinda weird concept, but maybe somebody will get it.     Even though, waitress informed pop that the fajitas were cooked in Teriayki sauce (WTF?), she said they were good and he took the veteran's bait. Big Mistake because our regular told us later that they just cook the chicken in Worcesthire sauce. His plate was swimming in salty, black liquid, only one tortilla was given, the guac had no chunks and looked like green toothpaste and the original salsa served with the chips was a watery mess of slightly hot red liquid (nothing in it). The $1 chunky salsa was better, but still on par with a chain or something (no offense to the much better chains in the area).      My $9 combo was a mess covered in a tasteless green sauce. The enchilada tasted like stale tortillas were used and the green corn tamale was all fluff and no green chile or corn present. The chile Relleno might have been the best item, but they used a green chile, not the traditional poblano.      Pancho needs a break, a new menu and can someone mention to them how to cook fajitas properly because that crap should be taken off the menu forever. Clueless restaurant and even more clueless people who think this is real Mexican food. It aint.

Eh2HC5dgDiqienVDLaPFXg.text: Been there many times throughout the years.  It is always busy, but, worth the wait,  The Pollo Fundido is excellent.  Sometimes herd to find a parking spot.

9DunafLUJBYkYcBAh0Lbqg.text: Absolutely delicious and my favorite place in town. This meal Is always two hours long though, service is extremely slow no matter which server you get. One of my top request is don't starve my thirst and refills are hard to come by. Food makes up for the slow service, be sure to check out the coupons in the newspapers and weekly adds.

XtrNIuStbtaDfMCiWjwVLg.text: I've eaten here a few times with the hopes I get something I like the next time I return considering the reviews. I still don't. The food is bland and greasy. Not very authentic IMO. They do give you a big portion for the price so I did like that. Also the service is great. I might go here again to try the famous pollo fundido. BCn6TkopRFxU2lNo9OmfLg.text: Not the best, but definitely not the worst. Good is always consistent and reliable. Waitresses are nice, and usually on top of our needs. Food usually comes real quick. If you are looking for a solid Mexican food place, this is the right choice.

eFfqGH45LdebIEHYPrNSiA.text: Poncho's is an Arizona institution, and has the best Mexican food in town!  Whenever we are craving authentic Mexican food, Ponchos is our first choice!  In fact, we recently took some visiting relatives from back east and they loved it and can't stop racing about the food!  I would highly recommend Ponchos to anyone looking for a great Mexican food experience.
