Service recovery  sucks ass. Never again.

V0aXtYVXyqpas8Ir3x3ySw.text: I went to Poncho's today for lunch with the BF and it was ok. The place was very busy, so I thought that was a good sign. We waited for a bit before being seated in one of the small rooms in the back. We were given chips and the salsa in the bowl and promised salsa in a bottle. The chips were very greasy and not that crunchy and the salsa tasted like very peppery ketchup...ick. After 5 minutes or so we were given the squeeze bottle which contained a very similar, but slightly less tomato -y, salsa...not a win. For lunch, I had the mini pollo fundido and the BF had a taco and tostada. My food was alright, the chicken on the inside of the burro was nothing special, but the sauce was good and the rice was really good. Sort of what I expect from a cheap Americanized Mexican restaurant. The BF's taco was fine....also nothing special, but not bad. The prices were decent and the portion sizes were too large. I think it's super funny that they are clinging to the fact that Bill Clinton ate here 15 years ago or so, they have the newspaper clippings all over....I definitely lol'd. Anyway, I wouldn't avoid this place, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.

RZS-kYYSznPSsgrz0p7HAg.text: Excellent service!! Pollo fundido was mouth watering!! Salsa and chips are always 5 stars!!

cSyOZVJhS7ISPfDAhkw52Q.text: WARNING: Everything is super deep fried... Been here twice and everything was way to greasy.  Have have been told they have a great happy hour including $10 pitchers of Margaritas. I'll shall have to try and repost my findings...

ireysDpDPPu3VRVJsdDvww.text: PONCHOS IS BY FAR #1 (Not to be confused with the dingy Panchos Buffet.)    This place in located in South Phoenix and is only about a 10 min drive away from the airport.. Makes it convenient for people who are traveling into or out of Phoenix and have that itch for real Mexican food. This place is always packed. The food is served piping hot, with great chili sauces and unlimited hot chips and salsa and is super affordable to boot! I recommend the Pollo Fundito - Marinated pulled chicken chimichanga that has a warm jalapeno cream cheese inside.. Not good for you, but tastes oh so good.. This place has great music, fantastic margaritas, and friendly service..  The one thing I do not like about this place is their Guacamole. It is unimpressive so don't waste your time adding that to any of your dishes. Lucky for us that we don't need the guac to make this place rock!  Side note... Bill Clinton dines here when he visits the grand canyon state.. They painted his picture on the wall where he usually sits. I'm a Republican and I keep coming back.

To4NNvcm0hmuPhRcyGkZWA.text: Poncho's is this native's favorite Mexican place, by far!! You just don't get any better than this. Simple, fast, cheap food served by super nice people. The place is no-frills but clean and casual. People are overstating the divey-ness of it, it's not that bad. I find it to be very relaxing and comfortable. Truly though, the food is what keeps me coming back for many years. Get a simple bean burrito with a side of rice and you'll see what I mean. Love, love, love this place. Getting hungry just thinking about it!

bMo0I8tNMeeyINrzoMUhEw.text: Poncho's is one of my favorite spots to come to with my family & co-workers. The food is great and very rarely do I have any complaints on it. I would give it a 4 or even a 5 star if it weren't for the hit and miss customer service. The last time I was there for lunch with some co-workers, we had crappy customer service. Our waitress was very short and dismissive. She barely looked at us when talking to us. She slapped the receipt on our table and ran off. Didn't ask us if we needed anything else or if it was all on one bill. When we told her we were paying seperately, she took off again and brought us back our separate receipts. She was annoyed that we didn't tell her we wanted separate checks. Um.... she didn't give us a chance!

_YrRGvdSUOdyJr2tpYhJYQ.text: This place was ok but then again I am a True Mexican wouldn't call it the best Mexican restaurant but it was decent

6vMrXf3pHKKiu67MhQn93w.text: More customer service. I had called my order in the said 10 minutes so I get there in 15 minutes still not ready took an additional 10 more minutes.  when I got up to the window it took them 5 minutes to even acknowledge I was there. tt_m_TjkUPuSgnAXoIkTDQ.text: Alright, it hurts me to do this, but after today, Poncho's is dead to me. I was a faithful customer for years as I grew up in the Laveen area. I returned today, excited for the same quality and feeling a little nostalgic.   Bleh. It was incredibly loud and every table had a crying baby. Don't get me wrong, I love babies, but every reasonable person has limits. Also, our waitress was awful. I'm not usually too picky, but she didnt once come by after our food was dropped off to ask how everything was. She was morose, made no effort to engage and everything we wanted, we had to chase her down for.   And we arrive...at the food. The zucchini appetizer is off the menu, big disappointment. My beef tamale was awful. I would have sent it back had my waitress ever returned. My chicken enchilada was edible but tasted like one of those frozen entrees. The salsa is still good, but I'm not about to drive down to south Phoenix if everything else sucks.   Sorry, Poncho's. You used to be high on my list but you've really lost a lot of flavor and character since my last visit.

O1aeF4jx5uuM29h4IGbz8w.text: This is my favorite place to eat good mexican food. We eat at this place almost once a week. The service is excellent, there's not much of a wait time. Definitely a place to to eat good mexican food.

obcwSRdwLvIrd26xKQZ0aQ.text: This place is freaking amazing. My boyfriend grew up eating there so he craves it from time to time. I've only eaten inside once and we usually get take out but it's so good. He gets the red chili burro and I get green chili. We also order a cheese crisp folded and side of chips and salsa. Yes all in one order, I seat half the next day. Highly recommend this joint.

eaMPBlu1s9KgYs2_Vwr1SQ.text: I use to come here a lot with family, and the food is delicious, but the customer service is a hit and miss. There  needs to be consistency with how diners are greeted. My complaint is about the lack of customer service I received yesterday. I called my order in over the phone, and when I arrived to pick it up; I was told that it would be coming out shortly. 30 minutes later....yes 30 minutes (although I called ahead) I had to ask one of the ladies behind the to-go counter where was my food. She asked me for my order, and once I repeated it; she said "Oh here it is; sorry about that ma'am." So basically I waited outside for 30 minutes for my food that was ready and just sitting on the counter. She was so engrossed in her conversation with her co-workers that she forgot to call my order??  I can't with this place...bad customer service can ruin a business reputation, and it seems that SOME of the employees there are on a mission to do just that.

6waNNXlqB2CiAw_tPVNCCA.text: I would give them a 5 but it's been a year since I've been there. Ponchos is Mexican Food to me. I compare all other food to Ponchos. I've been there easily a million times. I blame at least 50lb on my body to them. I say that in a good way. Great chips and sauce. I always get the green chili burro enchilada style. They have an awesome bean burrito too. I can review all day. Love you Ponchos. I'll be back next time I'm in town.

hWOCXmREh9yri2CLGtBVig.text: One of my favorite places to go for Mexican food in south Phoenix. The Mexican pizza is very yummy even for a last minute late dinner.

Pck-iiOKjPqnz5d-4asZhQ.text: A very authentic Mexican Food spot on south side of Phoenix. The style of the restaurant is very colorful and festive. Every time I have been there it is busy especially on the weekends breakfast thru lunch times. Had the green burro with rice and beans and it tasted like my own nana made it. Would definitely go back and enjoy other dishes.

KuYxcUzgwWsT_70KkzrN8A.text: My friend reminded me of the best part... When we walked outside after our horrible meal, there was a nasty used green condom on the floor. Yuck.

a3B6-OpuYz7ze0_sMJdCtw.text: I made a wrong turn to avoid an accident scene on Baseline Road...GOOD THING! I found Panchos!  This place is super cheap and super delicious!  I usually order the El Crudo burrito ($6.45 only!) and I love the Mole sauce!  The burrito is stuffed with Machacha beef and comes with rice and some lettuce...the sauce is the best Mole sauce I have ever had.    I have never had to wait for my food. Although the parking lot can get packed. This place is amazing. if I'm ever in phoenix again on business I'm going here!    Love it.   btw, I was on  mission to find some bomb ass Mexican food and was somewhat disappointed. People kept referring me to Filbertos.  WTF Go to PANCHOS!

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pres Clinton ate here. I feel honored.  Sorry I can&#39;t seem to rotate this damn thing.

VqyFJtk83XBFhSEHPzDBVA.text: Yeah,  wow,  Poncho's this Mexican food is amazing. I just knew I hit the jackpot after I saw my first order, the sampler platter. tamales are great here i get the green corn.  Man I'll drive here just to fulfill a tamale attack.    The place has a cool set up winding around room to room it just never ends. I"m glad its open a little late for those late night customers.    Watch out for lunch here during the week it can get full, its one of those place people know where to find.  Just of Central in South Phoenix.  I don't get out here that much  Destination location for sure. My personal note: we live in Arizona, experiencing some of the best Mexican food America does not know about  makes me really enjoy the valley "Poncho's Mexican food,  Kevin U. place  to try."  Kevin

kDMNOGT1z8xj-HjJCnJnaw.text: The Barracho burrito is incredible and just melts in your mouth. Their salsa is also fantastic. Poncho's never disappoints!

cF3nlx_nbIUcF147PY7GxA.text: A very good restaurant. Good hot sauce, Good chips, Excellent machaca tacos. Very good red chili burros. Cheese enchiladas are a little inconsistent, usually not cooked all the way but very good when they are.  Can be very busy at times.  One note for this and other Mexican restaurants. Why are people charged more when you order something without rice and beans? Most of the time the amount of food minus the rice and beans is way more than enough. I can't tell you how many times I see plates with rice and beans left on them. They just get thrown away.

QP35wYYSLWCyE332gmu81g.text: I'm giving this place two stars only because I enjoyed the chips and salsa. I ordered a combo of a Tostado,enchilada and A tamale. The tostado shell was overcooked, the enchilada was unremarkable and the Tamale had very little meat in it and tasted just like the enchilada . . I honestly had one bite of everything on my plate and then pushed it aside. My son ordered something else and he did not eat his meal either. My daughter in law had a green chili burrito and she loved it. So if you must go to this place try and order that. I wont be going back.

JRz57Inv93mTdBh9fvNKuQ.text: I've been coming here for over 40 years. The food has remained close to the same though it's not prepared with quite The same care as it was years ago. I particularly like the number 11, their green sauce is great. But it's just added to a plate and stuck in an oven and quite often the cheese inside isn't even melted all the way through. Your green corn tamale used to have either better ingredients or something, your corn is in Sweden anymore it's just not the same. It's just not the same. But it's still very good and I still keep coming back love the chips and sauce.

329pbPBbQXs36hyP_Oismg.text: My husband and I love this place! I get something different every time and it's always delicious! On the lighter side, their marinaded grilled chicken with rice and beans was so simple but just as delicious and satisfying as when I ordered a chimichanga. I love their margaritas too! This place can do no wrong.

fJlMNuabPvCS3sTrdfuWPQ.text: I have become pretty obsessed with their veggie burrito! They are generous in the avocado which I like. Friendly service staff inside and I love that you can call in an order and pick up at the window. However the ladies at the window need to be a little faster on helping customers when they see them outside.

paJ42QITSHAM8HT_560SFA.text: The food here is very good. We go here sometimes for work. No one ever complains, and we've been back multiple times.

rnSVFgRuaN3YETJzqZfGpw.text: The worst customer service ever!! We will not be returning. We were recommended this place by some friends so we decided to try it. 1) the place was overly crowded and tables are extremely close to each other. 2) the host didn't even greet us and seemed in a bad mood as she was walking us to our table.  3) our server took over 20minutes to ask what we wanted to drink and took another 10min to bring them to us by then we were ready to order.  4) another server brang out our food but we were never advised that she was our new server so we sat there waiting for the server we had initially no where to be found.(the food was nothing special by the way) 5) when we finally realized we had a new server she took FOREVER to bring us our check she came and went around our table over 5 times every time we would make eye contact so I can get her attention she would look away fast and walk away this made me super angry so we finally got up and headed to look for a manager we ended up bumping into her and she said she will get our check immediately.  H0RRIBLE. NEVER AGAIN.

zTp1WQ5VjlmCU17XK4zElw.text: The food here isn't bad,  and the service is always friendly - yeah, you're going to wait a while if they're busy but that's OK,  good things take time right?   Here's why it's only 3 stars from me:  it's just "OK".     A big serving and a lot of rich ingredients is good and all,  but basically it doesn't matter what you order,  everything here tastes about the same as everything else,   and while I wouldn't use the word "bland" to describe it,  it's also not exciting and there aren't any unique stand-outs.         So why do I keep going back?     It's near home and it's safe to take any picky eater here.

EPXz8LFGd0D_B02oNItDyg.text: I went to Poncho's for my first time and I will not be going back after this, The young lady in the front was SO RUDE and was also taking personal phone calls while we were waiting just get seated & the place wasn't even full for the time we had to wait  and another reason is it's so expensive and the food is no good. My nephew ordered the carne asada and it was so flavorless and dry, We told the waitress about it and she even agreed and she even said that no one ever ends up liking the carne asada. Luckily she was nice enough to take that plate off our bill. The only thing I liked was the chips!

ATTZe64IJUHXabtBm7MjZg.text: Everytime my husband and I fly down to Phoenix, Az. We have a tradition to order food here and eat it while watching the beautiful sunset on top of South Mountain. I am happy to say this place brings nothing but happy/cherished memories while living in Phoenix before moving to Salt Lake City. I would recommend this place to anyone requesting a great place to eat/order out.

8Ncu8R1SQSNfGx7RAQ5KXA.text: Having been to Poncho's many times over the years, and never being to excited about their food and service, we happened to be out and about, and hungry Saturday 11/1 around 9pm. I remembered Poncho's serves food late, so we stopped in to give it a try.   The place we packed. Hardly an empty table which seemed like a good sign. Service took quite a while, but there were several large parties around us, (one who clearly never heard of "inside voices", but rather "screaming voices") so they were busy. A simple "hello, be right with you" would have been nice though, as opposed to being completely ignored.  We loved the screaming child next to us, who the parents ignored and chose to drink many beers instead of correcting his behaviur. When he knocked some holiday decorations off the wall, the parents simply set them on the floor and went back to their beer. ( not the fault of Poncho's, but indicative of the typical clientele. I asked about beers on tap, and was told "Bud, Bud light, Miller). Seeems like a Mexican restaurant would have some Dos xx's , Tecate or something, but no.  We asked how the quesadilla was, and were assured it was fantastic, so we had that, and 2 different combo plates.   Well, the "quesadilla" was simply 2 heated tortillas with greasy runny orange cheese. No sides, no toppings, just orange goo.  Our entrees were no better. The beans were bland and tasteless, and were the burritos.. It was like eating air.  The beef taco was HORRIBLE. I literally watched oil run out of it as i held it up. I voiced my concerns, but was just given a shrug by the waitress.  I used the bathroom, which was a wreck, dirty and no paper towels or soap, and headed out their door for the last time.  I have never understood how people can rave about this place, but they can have it. I won't be back.

T_DRmNgX6VzyJg6R5kz6og.text: Ponchos is the go-to place for us when you're wanting good Mexican sit down and even take out. I love their house margaritas and the Boracho burrito will always be number one. We always sit in the bar because it feels more open and they have a projector screen where they play the most popular games even when  Vicente Fernandez is playing on the jukebox. I love this place.   The only complaint that I have is that it's only open until 10pm which is toooooo early! Love you Ponchos!  **To those with the bad reviews...you just don't know what to order. :P**

ZEd9EJEpanBcrn1irJli0g.text: I don't understand some of the bad reviews here. I have been driving to South Phx for years just to eat a Pollo Fundido at Ponchos. Last night we took a couple of friends who had never been. We have not been in over a year. Everything was great. Service, food was exactly as is always has been. Friends love what they ordered, one the beef chimi, the other pollo fundido. The totally enjoyed it as did I. I would highly recemmend this place as I always have. Its a family restaurant, cozy fun atmosphere. you  might wait a bit on a friday night and the bar is noisy, but it has a fun vibe .

ZlhyIY0HJkoa1lrmKrsGjA.text: Good food. Every time we go however it's spotty service at best. Staff isn't very attentive or perhaps they have way too many tables to take care of per waiter. This is the main reason why we elect to go elsewhere.

TTNf8F0UubSxM6i3S9h8xQ.text: We used to love this place, but have sadly watched it go down a steady downward slope in the last few years. I recently took my parents here while they were in town, and was actually embarrassed. The interior is all run down, the waitstaff is rude and doesn't even pretend to enjoy their job let alone provide any sort of customer service, and the food is so-so at best. Not sure how much longer they can survive, riding the wave of their past.

odal4lHpR5N2wBNalrCybA.text: If you want the Worst customer service come to this restaurant, the management staff has no concept of customer service telling the girls there to get me my shit so that I could get out of her window. SILVIA BARBA knew she was talking loud enough so that I could hear her I would never go back to this place the service or lack there of is what gets them one star if I could rate them less I would. If I was the owner of this establishment I would be ashamed to admit that the "manager" was an employee of the restaurant. Clearly she could use some customer service training or at least some coaching on how to deliver customer service. I will never go back to such a poorly managed establishment. SILVIA BARBA HAS THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE SKILLS AS A MANAGER. NEVER GO TO THIS PLACE THERE ARE PLENTY OF OTHER MEXICAN  RESTAURANTS YOU CAN GO TO. THEY SHOULD CHANGE THE SLOGAN TO " MEXICAN FOOD AT ITS ABSOLUTE WORST" they aren't the best at anything especially not treating customers with respect or professionalism.

IVVF3schhsrdw-IQMIUDxQ.text: Rude hostess girls. The place does not have wide space to move around especially from the door to the hostess stand.  For that obvious reason I kindly asked the hostesses that my party will be at the benches around the building, to call me when our table is ready.  The girl said okay.  Waited for a few and came back in to see that they gave out table away. I told the hostess dont tell me you will let me know when the table is ready and you don't . The other hostesses with dark hair and bangs rudely took us to a table and sat our party of 8 at a table where the kids had to sit on adult laps.  Food was not that great.  Wait was long, had to repeatedly ask for things.  The mean waitress girl came back and again rudely told my nephew "excuse me" as she sat another table.  Rude lazy employees with no manners.  Will happily not return or reccomend.

0znz5mG4sqCrMmiaTqHFMw.text: Just a 2 star spot at this point... there once was a time I'd get excited over this place, but the love is gone and so is my appetite...

o2p0JgtD9scWlOr75-c8GQ.text: One of my co-workers told me about this place. He said that it was a MUST that I get a chicken fundita. It was a huge chimichanga filled to the brim with chicken, everything that should be IN the burrito was on top. Unfortunately his description was better than the reality. Happy hour prices are cool. It's good for groups, they play music...it's like your neighborhood Mexican bar.

WaKNhwxxJptQ7BPZUuzM2w.text: In 5 years searching for a restaurant that offers True, good, real, Mexican food in the Phoenix areas, we finally found one! DELICIOUS tacos, refried beans and rice. The friendliest service. Tha ambiance is quaint and the restaurant is CLEAN!- Great job Ponchos!

LsWtC6hOItJ2E794w_wPSQ.text: Best food! Tonight we had Erik as our server and he was honestly one of the best servers we have had at any restaurant in a very only time. My girlfriend has been coming here for years and always had a great meal here but Erik is new to the team and showed a lot of pride and happiness in his job tonight! Defiantly recommended if you are looking for great service and food.

nntsMpb9sCk_xhKbtvmm0w.text: We really liked Poncho's. We started with the President Fiesta Platter which had a great variety. My favorite was the shredded beef chimichanga. Then I had the cheese crisp with guacamole and green Chile's. Yes the portions are very generous. And the waitress was ok. She started out great when we were her only table. Then once she had a couple others it took a bit to get water and tea refills. We would still go back. Food was great!!

sdMQqirEobzR4QVJP9leHA.text: Ponchos was very satisfying to me. I had ordered the Pollo Fundido and man it was delicious! I love me some cream cheese. Salsa and chips were also splendid. Only downside was our waitress took forever to get our drinks and food in. I still would recommend this place to a friend.

5u627DK9dsciEOqDzLorPA.text: Place is nasty food was cold don't waste your money  instead go to  federicos same price better food

gHjOZXh0Tp_glH4YCuddIQ.text: Meatballs in albondigas were raw.  I called the place since it was pick up and they said all of their albondigas are always that red in color.  Very disappointed as they didn't offer to correct the problem.

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. All meat balls look raw. I called the place to have them check meatballs but they say it&#39;s normal.  Didn&#39;t eat it to avoid being sick.

mf77Nqct4flKoSNN9OinJg.text: First off, what the heck kind of place charges their customers $1.00 for the "good" salsa to go with your chips, puts them in a soup cup (not bowl) and no free refills? The free salsa tasted more like ketchup than hot sauce. To top that off, why would any mexican food restaurant offer you EITHER beans OR rice with your meal, not both?!?!? And then when you ask for both you get charged extra without them telling you!?!? WTF!?!?!? Food wasn't even that great.  I don't know why we came back. Service was not the greatest. Felt bad for the party next to us cause they got seated right before us and we got our food before she even asked if they were ready to order. Manager was chatting it up with another table and one of the bus boys came by and she said something to him and once he was out of the room started talking crap about him to the customers. Will NOT be back.

v5ruIMalC3oxdQKO3WvCPA.text: Great place for good Mexican food!  The prices are very reasonable and excellent service!

n5c2PcMIntzJGQHzo22Qew.text: I'm not going to spend much time on this review because clearly they have somehow managed to build up a following and they are making the $$. Just to sum it up: - service was beyond horrible. Managed chaos...screw that, total chaos. We had this tatood waitress who couldn't give a shit. Literally EVERY person in our little room got pissed at her. That takes some serious dedication to be that shitty. - the food was bland at best. The beans were ok, but the rest...wtf was that shit? - place smelled funky...like a highly perfumed turd - too many dumb-ass female managers and waitresses running around doing absolutely nothing. They all worked at one speed. It was like that song Despacito, but instead of wanting to dance, I wanted to throw a cup at their head and tell them to hurry the fuck up. - parking was good.

X77nis5ffM0jAJcQ6GP20w.text: Still the best Mexican food in town! It will always be my favorite place to eat Mexican food. My usual order is a three way chimichanga, and I highly recommend it.

5tU-pShrb0Sh3kNnK21I4Q.text: UPDATE:.  Due to the late arrival of dinner last night, my family saved some of the food for dinner tonight.  There was a rock in the burrito meant for my niece.  ABSOLUTELY UNACCEPTABLE!!  There is no way a rock finds its way into a bean burrito by accident.  And when I say rock, I mean a dime sized pebble.  My family went to this restaurant at least weekly and would take our out of town guests.  I'm beyond upset and frustrated.  Customers have been lost.  Postmates delivery.   It was NOT Postmates with the issue as I have used them many times and the service is always great.  This is the worst service from Poncho's ever.  The order is never correct and is messy.  The To-Go staff is rude and unhelpful.  As far as food, they are amazing but they are about to lose my business for customer service and delivery.  Dining in is nothing special but not the worst.  They have the ability to be a rockstar restaurant in both delivery through a service, their pick up window and restaurant, but I don't see the attempt in moving that direction anytime soon.

jknjxd7SzM_lFMLz0w1Oig.text: Ponchos has changed over the years and not for the better!  Food is decent but the help is rude and does not answer the phone for to go orders.  When they do they are short and put you on eternal hold and often don't even come back on the line.  We did a order today, cheese crisp was the small flour tortilla....they think you will not notice...but the pizza box was huge and a little tortilla inside with some cheese on it.  Took me 30 min to order then was told that if we did not 'prepay' we could not do this because it was over 25.00!  Have been going there and ordering to go for 15 yrs and now all the sudden you have to prepay?  If they have customers that are not picking up their orders, the entire population should not be penalized for it...especially the customers that are loyal. Make a list of names and phone numbers of the offenders for gosh sakes!  Don't upset your regular customers!  The girl I spoke with was rude and mouthy and kept putting me on hold.  We wlll be finding another place to go to after being loyal customers all these years.  And oh by the way, they don't make their own tortillas! I know who does and I go there for 1/2 the price they charge at Ponchos!  100% markup on the tortillas BTW!  The mouthy girl on the phone was supposed to get me a mgr to talk but never came back on the line, neither did the mgr!  Bad for business.  Ponchos, sorry but there are way too many good Mexican Food Restaurants in Phoenix.....Accommodate your customers and don't skimp on food, like a itty bitty cheese crisp! I also noticed on the to go order, our rice and bean were is small aluminum containers, used to be in larger ones.  Portions are getting smaller and smaller.  Again, they think we longtime customers don't notice...well we do! VERY DISSAPOINTED INDEED! *************************************** Updated review - I did finally get a call back today from Syliva, M-F Mgr. She was very apologetic.  She is going to speak with the kids that take the orders and remind them that the customers are why they have their jobs..  And also gave us a partial credit for our dinner.  She said nothing has changed and the portions should of been there.  She was amazed they used the small flour tortilla for our cheese crisp.  She was not happy.

jBYX0XnKHuoJZ11k0D-BHg.text: Great food, service and prices. The pollo fundido is my favorite!  This place is always busy, but the wait time usually isn't very long.

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States

T-3RvJVW1lztin9nItHLRQ.text: Always loved ponchos especially the Red Burrito !! Would recommend this place to everyone .

1VSZzittwJ-C0eGtJxlNgg.text: My first time here and I left never wanting to come back again. Our server was nice but it seemed like she had no idea what she was doing. Maybe she was new but non the less anytime we asked her a question about the menu or drinks she had to go ask someone else. She didn't even bring out silverware for us when she brought out our food and we were always waiting on drink refills. It took forever to get drinks and order the food. I was starving by the time we ordered and i ordered the taquitos with bean and rice. The shell of the taquitos were over fried and  when you bit into the food it tasted like stale chips. My other friends got tacos and they said the same thing about the taco shells. On top of all that the credit machine was down when we were trying to pay . She came back and asked if we had cash and when we told her we didn't, she kept saying well we can only take cash so I don't know. We asked her if she could take our card numbers down and charge it when the machine was working again but she said we couldn't. She said they were trying to fix it so we waited another hour and half and by that time I was pissed. She didn't come back to see if there was anything they could do while we waited and kinda just forgot about us. After all the waiting she comes back with the credit card number on the receipt and told us to put the phone number on the back and they will call us when they are going to charge the card. Service sucked and food sucked

NoJTNWwtm9jKlPmm9gEbmw.text: OK food but horrible service.   Order over the phone was told that it would take about 10-15 minutes. Arrived in about 30 minutes to give them time to make our office order. The cashier went from 2 lines to one and there was no one informing people in line what was happening. Once we got the food back to office, it seem that it was not even our order as many items were different from what we had called in. First time and last time we will use this place for our Friday office lunch.   The poor pregnant lady working behind the counter was doing her best with out any help. The people that were there that had ordered were still waiting after we had left 30 minutes later after arriving at the location.   I do not recommend this place for orders that are for multiple parties or at busy times that means 11-2pm. Even walking in to order may provide one with a lifetime of frustration for ok food. Save your sanity and time and go somewhere else.

df8mpzjffzS4GcJTS4zzKw.text: I was visiting Scottsdale for business and my local cousins took me to Poncho's for dinner. This is their favorite Mexican restaurant in the area. I tried the sampler with a presidential theme. Good variety of the Mexican dishes available. I enjoyed each piece of the plate and the addition of a large marg made it even better. I have it on his authority that the pollo fondito is awesome. Why only 4 and not 5? Slow to non-existent service at the front and really short handed waitstaff.

ClccZTAS0J-HhYUbo2_o4w.text: We ate here in July 2013. I heard great things about their nachos. They really were good!! However, after being blown away by the nachos, I was a little disappointed with our main entree. I wasn't sure, but the rice and beans weren't as good as other places.... but this might be a location thing.   I will definitely go back to just eat nachos!

lBVISuCsft1mt1Ul3x3_ug.text: We found Ponchos by stumbling over it while looking for another address. It was lunch time so why not???  The short review is - just stop what you are doing right now and go there for lunch! You live in Tucson and it is in Phoenix? I don't care, leave early it's worth it.  OK a bigger review.  Big surprise!  First -- The parking area is deceptive - go to the back instead of squeezing into one of those front spaces.  Then - go in and ignore any line that might have formed - it will clear up really fast.  Now sit down and prepare to be surprised. I bet you think most Mexican food is just Lettuce Cheese and some meat arranged in different presentations with Salsa. Well that is True but Ponchos actually is a different taste and it is wonderful.   Chips - the chips are light and crunchy not burned, thick and greasy. You may well ask to buy a bag of them to take home. We did. Twice now.  Salsa - the salsa comes in a squeeze bottle and I was really skeptical because I like it in a dish  to dip out of. The salsa is best served like they do it and it is spectacular. Not to hot, nice tang and flavor just goes all over your mouth. They provide a dish if you want to put the Salsa in the dish. (get takeout to go with those chips you are going to buy)  I have now had Tacos (you just have to always do that) and Enchiladas. Both were an experience. My associate had the red chili in  a burro and  I tried it. You really should just drive there to try the red chili.  This is a small thing but I like coffee and restaurants frequently keep coffee around or do not have it ready. Ponchos keeps fresh coffee hot and ready, and it is good coffee.  My only issue - no Posole and I bet these guys could make a killer Posole.

Nq4kP7oEw0LSGU2xnYhW4w.text: Pretty Decent food at good prices. My favorite is the Pollo Fundido. Seeing the photo of the cheese crisp here on Yelp, I'm definitely ordering that next trip. The staff is very friendly and service is good. It used to be a sign of a good restaurant if they brought water to your table before you ordered. Ponchos brings you water, chips and salsa. Even before I lived close to Ponchos it was one of my favorites.  * I advise taking a table in the bar or else you might get stuck next to a very noisy kitchen or the bathrooms.

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8f-cfbO0E8UeFtVSclSWDQ.text: Service was good. Had the chimichanga it was very good. Great atmosphere and very clean. I would eat here every day if possible.

aCSV732E7Ot6El2KfH-RHg.text: We love the food here however the takeout has gotten really slow. We ordered at 5:58 pm tonight and they said 15-20 minutes. We are still here waiting at 6:39 with no food. It would be okay if we didn't have an impatient 2 year old in the car, it's exactly why we got take out!! I have been going here since I was little and we love the food hopefully they can get more help or expect to wait.

HZtDUulWbnUgPcKdzNKpZQ.text: Love the greasy chips! and salsa. Shredded beef tacos are my fav. Rice is good. Price is right. Too bad this place is too far from home or I would it here more often.

podIsvIClqsv_XE3xARDOg.text: The ponchos pizza with the green chile is always worth the drive !! There have been many times all we go for is that ponchos pizza , love the chips and salsa too ! So great we live right up the street ..

6rwiI0NGGpyhiRaGbkoVGg.text: Back in the day I used to drive all the way from Surprise to eat here, yes the food was that good. They used to have the most killer Pollo Fundido as well as amazing chunky salsa.   Time has certainly changed this place.. we started with a cheese crisp with green chiles, delicious.. nice and crispy with just the right amount of chile strips.. also ordered their killer chunky salsa which was as good as I remember it.   Then come my Pollo Fundido swimming, Im serious about this, swimming in a pool of grease!! They didn't even bother draining the thing before tossing it onto my plate. Was disgusting too, not even like clear oil but dark brown grease. Vile. Then the Misters Sampler showed up.. this thing was a fucking mess! You couldn't tell what was what under the piles of sauce and lettuce until you took a bite. Mini chimis were burnt, mini tacos burnt, tamales, cold and hard.. was a complete wreck.   After a few bites we called it.. major loss of appetite.. a shame too cause the salsa was actually really good but the entrees were inedible.   Meanwhile, the Mister was attached to the toilet within a few hours of eating here.. he was sick all day the next too.. so word of caution, eat here at your own risk.  Im sure going to miss the good meals I used to have here, what a real shame.

1TIGNhFYZ0OV-8sx4gbEHA.text: Worst take out service ever! I've been picking up food at least once a week from the take out window, lately it seems every time I go there is a mistake with my order, they forget food or give me the wrong order. Yesterday they forgot my abondiga soup, I had to drive all the back to let them know. When I told them they forgot my soup, the server at the window was very rude and questioned if I was telling the truth and not trying to get a free soup out of them. After asking everyone in the kitchen if they remembered packing a soup she finally just threw a soup in a bag and gave it to me. When I get home I picked up the bag and the soup dropped right through the bottom of bag, she didn't secure the lid and it spilled all over the inside of the bag. I called and complained to the manager, she gave no apology, and told me that there is nothing she will do. I told her I'd never go back and she laughed and hung up. They seem to always be rude as it is but this was the last straw. Food is over priced and the restaurant needs remodeling as the carpet smells really bad (what restaurant has carpet anymore?). So long, another long time customer gone! Guess I'll drive to the BEST MEXICAN RESTAURANT IN TOWN...Rositas Place on McDowell /24th street!

0YzbO5adE_wnbLpQAa3ZmA.text: My friend and I  love our  Friday night  diners.....we start with a LG margarita on the rocks. Then the food...bring it on......great Times.......

txnPetZZ6En3DXOVdeEn4w.text: I love this place so much , my mother in law was the first person I had gone here with and now me and my fiance are HOOKED ! So good , I know the wait is super long but it's so worth it ! I'm obsessed with the chimys  will be at ponchos this Thursday with the hubby ! Yesssss

EXdtpwlb4Ka2NU3Jmhx4EA.text: I Was was so excited to have lunch there. since moving to AZ i have heard so many great things about this restaurant however when I got there totally disappointed the culinary experience hasn't caught up yet in Phoenix,AZ the food was less than mediocre, And the counter tops at the bar were sticky;( this old mom-and-pop joint, is thumbs down for me.......;(

uq75RcjUECH6Esrgl2dlGg.text: Best cheese crisps and chicken tacos! I'm really picky so everything else on the menu is average tasting! Pollo fundido is pretty good!

uBdM7j1bR_WgnKmCmqXbhw.text: Wow.. a waiting line on a Friday afternoon means somethings good here.. I was not disappointed. Love it all.. the presidents plate is amazing, service it top notch I will be back.. chips and salsa alone are like crack. I can't get enough

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pres plate

xgAZLK1R8KCTqyuSm4f1iA.text: Hands down, the best shredded beef taco I've had in Phoenix.  Fun atmosphere, affordable and casual.  It appears to be a busy joint so I'd expect a little wait for a table unless you're ok with bellying up to the bar.  Can't wait to go back!

OBAeDkTqMpJ-gFlagNq-rA.text: Ponchos has the best pollo fundido in town. not to mention the Mexican pizza with red or green Chile is fire!!!!! And if you try the child's & salsa you'll want to slap yo lady!!! Lol...(bomb)

oKzX2ILS0GiVm5qT0s8-aQ.text: Had takeout from here...the food was hot and worth the wait! The tamales were really good! I plan on going back! They have amazing salsa and great service in their Togo area. I haven't eaten inside yet but I plan on it! Great food!

H8xmaN4-kiWok8QHeducOw.text: I've been coming here for over 25 yrs and not one time have I had a bad experience. They do get busy and during those times there is a long wait if you go during those times. I have dined in and called in my order and pick up to go service many times. Food always taste great and portion sizes are good. I regularly get pints of their salsa from the to-go service. I usually get a green chili burrito or red chili burrito enchilada style. Their chicken burrito deep fried is my son's favorite. It's big so he usually shares it. I reccomend you go try it out.

6PAB00Wu3JlFHb1PFMHS9A.text: Not a place to come for lunch...the front staff simply suck. I waited out front in the cramped hallway for over 20 minutes and after another 5 minutes, the young girl who looked upset already sat me down on the exact table I asked for when I arrived. Everything seemed to run a a turtle pace and it didn't seem much different than yesterday when I stopped for lunch.  I am not sure what the deal is but you'd figure they do better when it's not super busy...  Not a place I feel comfortable recommending for lunch or dinner...other guests waiting voiced being unhappy with the operation of this establishment.  On a positive note...the chips n salsa are excellent and the meal portions are good for the price.  Didn't get to visit the restroom here but by the looks of the layout...it may not much to be impressed with...  They have a nice parking lot...oh n I didn't get any utensils.

pK1NatUMWMMUoeXqHtH9Bw.text: First, I will say the service was great. We had a party of about 10 and received fabulous service. Drinks were always full, chips, salsa, etc...no complaints at all.   The two stars is for the service - zero stars for food.  The food on the other hand....most of us got the pollo fundido. Eh. And I mean "eh" at best.  A few got the fajitas. I was expecting the tray of sizzling fajitas to come through the restaurant and make everybody's mouth water. Nope.  In fact...the people who ordered the non-sizzling fajitas said they were awful and tasted like they had been cooked in....soy sauce.   Overall....never been a huge fan of Panchos to begin with...I could never understand the wow-factor....there are so many other better places.

y2Cii06exepj8ScPpiAHtA.text: I've been here before and the food previously has been very delicious and the service has been very great but today the food was mediocre and the service was also mediocre. Maybe it has to do with the fact that we arrived an hour before closing. There was something off about the chicken during this visit. It tasted very bland and the texture was very flaky almost like tuna as if it came out of a can.   My friend ordered rice but they gave him beans instead. We didn't make a big deal out of it since were not that picky but that just proves that they weren't listening while taking my order. They brought us warm chips in the beginning which was nice and they also brought an empty salsa cup. When we asked about the salsa they brought it. When we finished the first salsa cup we asked for more salsa and they said it would be an extra charge. We said okay and just played it cool because at least the first salsa cup was complimentary, right!! WELL NO THEY ENDED UP CHARGING ME FOR 2 SALSA CUPS!!! They were very deceptive. When we asked for a to go box they didn't even offer a bag. Service today could have gone better. I honestly loved this place but after today I'm not sure I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken looks like canned chicken from COSTCO

R7FaoJtfO1XdkiK0ez9Cfg.text: The chimichanga with shredded beef is huge and delicious, the salsa and chips are endless and super tasty and delicious keeping the whole family happy. We also ordered the Albondigas soup which came out perfectly. The tortillas are handmade and fresh to order. We really enjoyed our experience here and the music was on point!

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The spot where president Clinton sat when he ate here

GF-n5wZEaCqrLvFxQjtFcw.text: I hadn't been here in a while.  But.....I went to take my kids and had a good time.  It's not by any means a high end place but for what you pay it's pretty good.   It was a house turned into a restaurant with rich history of the founders of Ponchos.  The President Bill Clinton even dine here.   My favorite thing is probably the margaritas.  They are amazing!!!!  I had good service and it might feel tight and it does have low ceilings but the charm makes up for it.  I'm glad to have this gem in south Phoenix.

9-dRw7bxZ4PiHShUKK4Mjg.text: The Pollo Fundido!!!!  THE. BEST. DISH. EVER!!!  We were visiting the area and came across this little dive and I'm so glad we did!!  It was busier than I expected but that was reassuring to me that this was a good place.  Service was quick and friendly, we took our large order to go and devoured it after the first bite, before we could take pictures for a review.   I highly recommend!!!!

MUo6hZ48ZNlsUVEI5xu2MQ.text: Food was cold and tasteless. Their drinks were good and that's it. They were so full it all felt rused.

Enk_soosnfWGUL7bsxhc2g.text: WHAT HAS HAPPENED TO PONCHOS!!!! Was the place for Mexican Food in South Phoenix. Good food, good drinks & good times!!! BUT NOT NO MORE!!!! Went in May 2019, June 2019 and August 2019 and the food was AWFUL!!! Ordered two chicken tacos with side of rice for myself, daughter ordered the red chilli burro enchilada style. Both were cold, the rice was half frozen, the chips tasted stale and found mold in a couple of chips, the salsa tasted expired, tangy and smelled weird too!!! Did not eat anything and got up and left. Waitress tried to catch me but we kept on walking out the door. Walked across the street to Tortas Paquime and had a warm good meal in Aug. In May and June went home and had cup of noodles!!! Sure was better than what we where served at Ponchos! I hate to see Ponchos go but if the owners don't do something to fix the issues, change the decor and bring it back to life. Bring it back to the pride of South Phoenix, IT WILL CLOSE !!!!.....shame too, lots of good memories at Ponchos :(..

nDxE1l_sVwMAnC4N1uBMZA.text: Their food is decent but is the worst service I've had at any restaurant ever. Been here a few times and it's always the same rotten service and then when u ask for something from the servers they give u attitude

fXF1sV8T3jSXuCvVrHvK5g.text: the house salsa is delicious, some of the best salsa i've ever had I'm not big on sauce, yet their chips are fresh and hot. I love their margarita, fresh strawberries, blended to perfection, you can not go wrong with their food, sometimes I just come in for the drinks by themselves

IDeIla2oCfuoJx6x1SjK7Q.text: Ponchos seriously needs to replace the person who answers the take out order calls. On two separate occasions I literally canceled orders and decided to go elsewhere for my family, because of this lady's attitude. She is rude, doesn't listen to what you are ordering and then cops attitude when you try to correct the order. I know they are busy, but that's the job she chose.  A customer shouldn't feel pissed over a simple placement of an order. Especially when the food isn't anything spectacular.

wSXxo1eHyai4epkVZmfing.text: I've come to this restaurant so many times. Not sure what happened to it. The hostess is at a table with her friends joking around with the kid that cleans the table. We had to wait for a bit before anyone even came to our table. When we put in our order the server took about 20 min to tell me they were out of what i had ordered. Horrible experience. Not sure what's happening to this restaurant but I will definitely not be coming here again. So sad to see how it's changed.

fR6cxJx1dg-g34XlRCzFRA.text: I have always loved this place. I've been coming here for 40 years. The food is great! The service is great. The Building could use some sprucing up.

ag2_KiLr467b9ZjNaOnHeA.text: This place is really good! I had driven by this place multiple times and every time noticed it was packed. Now I know why! So far, I have had their tacos, cheese crisps, margaritas, and pollos fundidos and none of them disappoint. If you love Mexican food, you've definitely gotta try this place. I honestly can't wait to try more items on the menu. The restaurant itself has a pleasant vibe that makes me feel right at home. I love the decor and soft lighting. Our server Irene was also very nice. She did a great job checking on us and keeping us updated on how our food was coming along.

tzi26PqYXEucGaoXfF9crg.text: Food was super delicious.  We had chicken enchiladas . Enchiladas were enchanting.  Red chili added intense flavor to our enchiladas.  Wonderful dinner! Service was superb. Our waitress was super efficient.  All staff was friendly and helpful. Only thing was we had to wait 30 minutes but we didn't mind.

faSRSC9i3SWVhYzGwq4I4A.text: I love eating here, from my past experiences food is made to order and nothing is ever cold when brought to your table. Friendly staff and affordable prices that allows their staff to be taken care of at the end of the day, more ability to tip.   Setting: It is a small location try to visit duirng their not so busy hours for a better exerience in my opinion.

awMbuWFxWumiWqRSWuGdyA.text: This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants near me. I Found this place by accident. The food is very authentic and delicious. They do not skip on their portions and their chunky salsa is delicious. I had the #11 and I will have it again. I am very picky about my Mexican food being Latino I can usually make it myself but this was like being taken back to moms kitchen.  Like I said they do not skimp their Strawberry Margaritas are my favorite and if you like mango that's delicious as well. Place was friendly and neighborhood bar atmosphere. You can not go wrong with Panchos. My new favorite place for Mexican food and margaritas.

R-K9VWRU2bjoMms4cPUDFg.text: First time here. So the food was good had the muchacho grande. My date had the enchilada lunch serving. The food was hot and delicious. I read some comments regarding the wait staff being rude, no problems on my end. They were courteous and on point. Real comfort Mexican food. Will be back.

UllBi_kE0V_sB1d96u1XGQ.text: My favorite place to come for Mexican food or when I'm on the southside love this place! I always order a red chile chimichanga enchilada style with the rice and beans  It's Delicious and definitely a must try!

Q9kKNPeUZBZcjkOnXqmPhQ.text: Well the first two times we went there the food was great. This time it was obvious that they use canned chicken and the portions size are almost half of what they used to be. It's a shame their chicken fundido was amazing, but with the canned chicken it's gross. So to management yes we noticed you changed to canned chicken. Might want to go back to grilling your own chicken.

N6GFAuP3QbWZOUcMJ-jD_A.text: The food here was shockingly awesome given its appearance!    We went here randomly because another restaurant was closed.  It does not look like much.  Sketchy parking lot - complete with a pile of vomit by the ramp!  The inside is cramped.  We ate in a room that looked like it had been something else originally, with way too many tables crammed in.  I ordered a pina colada, and stupidly chose the large size.  Large is a ridiculous understatement!  This thing was the size of a fish bowl or something.  Not one of those stupid beta fish bowls either.  The large drinks mean business!!  It was pretty good too.  Everything we ate was really, really good.  I had the burrito and my friend had a taco salad.  Everything was great, including the salsa, but the taco shell was AMAZING.  So perfectly cooked and tasty.  It's weird to get this excited over a taco shell, but it's totally warranted.  So good!!  I would definitely go out of my way to get something with this amazing shell in the future.

2KsoVCpcXIpJ1HHCXGQtaw.text: The host was a little bitch....telling me that she needed to get past me....well if she paid a little bit of attention she would've noticed that i had nowhere to move bc i was letting her customers get past me...as to the food, it was good i ordered some chimichanga or.something that had white cheese on it...either way it was good ...the set-up of the tables sucks....feels like an overcrowded military cafeteria, not a restaurant

Eamw0u-dNmN2e0-hivBihQ.text: Really good food! Only thing is the inside is kind of strange, tons of hallways and different rooms, looks like it was probably a house before it became a restaurant. Not the best in on the inside but the food is good

71h9Irgb2tqNijOdS8fTAw.text: Food was just plain awful and it was like eating in a filthy basement. How do places like this stay in business?

eIFpdfkGjYy4a_wYhkL0cQ.text: Yeah, pretty decent mexican food, GREAT big giant margaritas.    Done lunch and now dinner 3 times here.  I don't wanna advertise this too much because I'm afraid that if too many people catch on, the restaurant will figure it out and put a stop to it BUT...Once a buddy and I figured out the secret to getting hammered on their margaritas for cheap:   Order a pitcher of margaritas with NO ICE.  They are OK with that!   You get 3x the amount of margarita, and they will still bring you glasses full of ice.  Go figure.  Winning, Duh!    I guess by reading these reviews that it's hit or miss with the food, but their margaritas are worth going there for, even if the food does suck on your particular visit. They are just damn good margaritas. KILLER margaritas.  Seriously.  Also, regardless of the food and other qualities that make a restaurant what it is, my take-aways are always based to some degree on how good of a time I had there.  If the food sucks, but I still have a good time, I'm gonna remember that and that's gonna be reflected in my reviews.  Maybe it's just the good company, I don't know, but at this place, I have always had a good time, and I don't remember the food ever being less than good.    Go have yourself a good time!

Y8SoH0oRlZz_f7qtUehyIQ.text: Worst customer service. Good food, so it is always busy. Unfortunate they prove they don't need any more business with the way they treat their guests.

2Eb5KBu19_xXT3xqnSHMtA.text: Poncheros never lets us down. We regularly come to this location and the staff is always so friendly and the food is always guaranteed delicious!!

khWT9OLaguAqqx2Z2L7BkA.text: I was really looking forward to eating here. We went on Saturday night, 01/06/18. What a huge disappointment! I ordered the President's platter of mini items. The only thing edible was one miniature taco. Never in my life have I had a green corn tamale that I didn't like...until Ponchos! I can't even describe the taste other than to say it was NOTHING like a green corn tamale. The chimis were way over fried. The filling was disgusting....tasted like red chili powder. The "chunky" salsa was gross and I had to request it twice before knowing how bad it was. Maybe they can fool white folks, but this Latina wasn't happy. My roommate ordered the fajitas. No sizzling platter. The beef was obviously overcooked as were the peppers and onions....and it all tasted like teriyaki sauce...WAIT...where am I? Oh yeah, in a MEXICAN food restaurant, not an Asian restaurant. The rice and beans were good! I was praying the waitress would not utter the words, "did you like your food", but alas she did! My roommate immediately said "no", and this is a man who rarely complains. At least they did not charge for my meal. None the less, I will never step foot in Ponchos again! The food at Federico's on 35th Ave and Baseline is a 1000% better.

lfwO2-JUYKpPnd5i8iWA4w.text: Disgusting atmosphere.  Food was mediocre, but in my table of four, the other three people all received their food while I waited about 25 minutes for mine. No apology or anything. I didn't even want it by the time it came since everyone was already done eating.  This was after about an hour wait to even sit down The staff was rather unpleasant looking and acting, dirty carpet and just nasty in general. Go somewhere else.

ZrOzWG38vhmngtAFKP7lQQ.text: Had the Pancho Villa burrito and ate it in the El presidente room...If this place is good for the one and only Slick Willy Clinton its good enough for me..Highly recommend!!!!

U6w_zP1qppPKD68jWfxAxA.text: Best Mexican food I've ever had. Came here all the time as a kid and will continue to come here as long as I'm in Arizona. I've had bad service here but you get that everywhere you go. I will continue to come because the food is that good. It's even worth a 2 hour wait.

fzeAROp9L4Yi_ipkvByLVA.text: Came here the other day and i honestly feel like this place is overrated. Ordered a tostada and it was SOGGY by the time it got to my table. For this kind of food it's nothing I can't make at home.

Da1XCXAEtbp2qmfKO11H2g.text: Today was not a good day. For a Sunday it wasn't as busy as I expected but today it's my daughters birthday and we wanted good Mexican food. The waitress was very nice, a little busy but nice it's her birthday too. I think their bus boys quit because the table next to ours has yet to be cleared and it's going on 30 minutes, so this fly has found an excuse to circle around us. I'm not giving her two stars I'd give her five, but whoever is managing should be written up because there's really no excuse. We felt like we were eating in the kitchen. Just got the check and ready to go...still no bus boys :-(

W3ecatvmr4iYeLpgKpmwRQ.text: Since my last review, we have had a few trips where the service was great! Food is amazing as always, they definitely deserve the 5 star

K1ThBsPA9AMigQjPTwIm8Q.text: Food good quality however the waitress was loud and obnoxious. Someone with the hospitality of a bowling alley snack bar attendant . I don't understand how the owners would hire her . The reputation of the restaurant is at risk .

ox_VOzZrGtjZn9olWtlR4A.text: Solid Mexican American food. The place is like a old house with very low ceilings. The service is very non memorable.  Serving sizes were quite large.

yK7nLIiA8E5qVmal89qtQg.text: Wow this place was packed for a Thursday night. With a half an hour wait I was expecting great things. Everything was just average. The chips were greasy and the salsa wasn't anything to write home about. The pricing is very reasonable. The Carne Asada was thick but very chewy, not the best piece of meat. The frozen margarita was very good and I had a bite of someone's tamale and tostada and those were both very good. The ambiance is more of what people go for I think. The interior is very cozy and welcoming like someone's home.

2j1LBnpNF0x9MBinX7BXJA.text: The food here is very good. Although I haven't really tried anything besides the Pollo Fundido (Fried chimichanga filled with shredded chicken and topped off with a jalapeno cream sauce.) Amazing!! My husband had tried a lot of other things in the menu, but always goes back to the Pollo Fundido.   The service is not the best since they're almost always packed inside. You will probably only see your server an average of three time like mentioned in another review. The space is very limited it used to be a regular home which was converted into a restaurant.  You sit very close to the other table little space to move around. If you can ask to be seated in the first dining room area. The rooms in the back of the restaurant get very hot and uncomfortable.  They also have a bar if you like to eat around loud music.

LbNy0UIMjtvCMoUrRizaVw.text: Just okay...now.  Ponchos used to be so much better than my experience today. This was actually my first time dining inside the restaurant instead of take-out. It was no doubt really cool to see the presidential room dedicated to Bill Clinton, but the food today in no way represented that prestige.  As usual with any Mexican restaurant, we got chips and salsa.Unfortunately, the salsa lacked the flavor that I remembered it having. For lunch, I got the Borracho Burro and got to try a tamale and chicken enchilada. The enchilada was okay, but the tamale flat out sucked today. It was pretty flavorless and didn't feel like it was made with any heart. My burrito was alright, but it didn't have any umph to it flavor wise... I could order the same thing at a lot of different restaurants in the valley...it was mediocre.  Today was a sad day because my visit today made it just that much harder to drive out to South Phoenix to dine here. It's not just the distance anymore, but it's due to a lack of desire for Poncho's renowned dishes.   I hope whatever happened here turns around, but I'm not the only one who feels this way, and that's a shame.

photos.caption: Photo of Poncho's Mexican Food and Cantina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Borracho Burro

nodvpIzfFKxKJISm-As3pg.text: I ordered hardshell tacos from the take out here today and they were very good. I tried this place after a friend recommended it and was happy with the tacos. Will have to try a few other menu items to get a better overall picture of what is available here.

Ub4Pclbb6bV-nxFVdBbp0g.text: I've been a patron of this establishment since I was a young child. When I thought of authentic Mexican food, I immediately think of Poncho's. It has been a many years since the last time I've eaten there and had a hankering for some good Mexican food. However, I was deeply disappointed in what I experienced. I ordered the Tamale Especiale with the  jalepeno cream cheese sauce. I know the sauce is the same from the Pollo Fundido (my favorite), but it tasted nothing like it. I tasted no cream cheese. It tasted like sour cream with chunks of jalepeno. Even the jalepeno didn't taste like jalepeno! The chicken was flavorless. I couldn't tell there was chicken in it. My mother ordered a beef chimichunga with red sauce. She complained that it was also had no flavor and got sick afterward. I hope this is a one time occurrence because through the many years of eating there I've never had a bad meal...never!

ux1Y32eVDUqzWE3FkVpOaA.text: Went there with a group of about 8 people.  I ordered a 'big' margarita...which actually wasn't bad.  The food on the menu looked good, but I was not a fan of the chips and salsa.  I know most people rave about it...but the whole squeeze bottle salsa was actually too thin for me.  I like my salsa chunky so that I can dig in with my chips.  Anyways, I ordered the my food and was happy with it.  It was very good.  Probably worth 4 stars in my book, but since I only gave this restaurant 3 stars your probably wondering why only 3 of you just said it's worth 4 stars.  Well the reason I knocked it down was because of the service.  Just not very good at all.  Our service seemed irritated everytime we asked for anything.  She only came to check on us 1 time during the whole meal.  We had to get up ourselves and go to the kitchen to get a side of sour cream and our own napkins.  I'll try them again to see if maybe she was just the bad apple of the bunch.

xlDz-EaDY-ozKtrLu85ReA.text: Although i love Ponchos and the food is awesome, i hate the take out girls. They mess up every time we get take out. They have no respect for customers and employees. I don't feel comfortable calling and complaining every time and i mean EVERY TIME, they forget something in my bag or mess the whole order up. I live in laveen and by time i get home I'm not going back for a mistake that happens way too often. Example: I go yesterday to get our evening dinner. Made it simple but we did order a lot. I paid with my credit card. Well i checked my bag before i left the window. Strike 1: half pint of chili i ordered wasn't in there, but they insisted it was. Oops try again. Strike 2:  I ask for my receipt, not credit card receipt but the food receipt showing what i ordered. Response to that was well ummmmmmm when you use your credit card the only receipt you get is the transaction one you sign. My response is no that's wrong i want my food receipt. She refused. Strike 3: when she closed the window on my face. WWJD? Walk away i guess. I had my hands full, my two kids with me and I was very tired. I'm over it. Take out window will not see me for a while. I hope Ponchos management looks into a customer service class for these ladies, because these ladies acting like that now at such a young age will find out real soon when life hits them as adults, that they need to be CLASSY.

tUsApWFoeCkvH0Jlju4Wvg.text: Visiting Phoenix and our friends who live in town often go there.  It was super busy and we had to wait 20 minutes for a table on a Thursday night, chips were greasy, in fact all the food was extra oily, flavors ordinary, services extra spotty as our very polite very overwhelmed waiter (with only 2 days experience) struggled to bring out food that took a long time to come and in fact one of us had not received her food and 3 of us were done.  I don't think they'll be back soon and we won't ask to go there....to bad, we were in the "Clinton Ate Here Room"

S7WWoD0Vkzco2Et87Xbg6Q.text: I've lived in this side of town my whole life and I would always see this place booming with business so I decided to give it a try. Omg j have no idea what people see in this place. The food was not good at all I found myself having to middy it with salt, pepper, lemon, and hot sauce to to even enjoy it a bit. Now not only does their food suck but this location is so dark and crowded it's very much outdated and everything looks really dirty this is a huge red flag. Onside ring you eat/pay there. I will never go back and I hope I saved some of you guys a trip there.

b_8J1Na4bClS9STxNhOIxQ.text: Food was good. Was a lot of food too. I got the chimmi with beef and green chilli.   Seating is very tight. So if ur really fat not the place to be.   The service was bla... Only saw the waitress 3times. (When she took our order, brought out our food and took our check) didn't get refills .

Tw9vIr1hR9GUae0Et54VFA.text: I've been coming here for 10 years now and can say without a doubt that this is the best Mexican food on this earth.  If you want the world's best bean burrito then look no further.  I hope ponchos lives on forever because I am now dependent on ponchos bean burrito for my very survival.

8clQGp-bq24uSZJs8kBzEA.text: I go every time I visit Phoenix! Love the Mexican Pizza, the salsa, and the atmosphere. I wish we had food like this in the South.

UEbuot6I7hLfL2U2sA2F3A.text: We live in Tempe, my wife works in Phoenix and we both make the trip to Poncho's for lunch and sometimes dinner. It is worth the drive as their food is by far, the BEST! We've been coming here since 1991, and yes, several new places have come and gone, but the best remains. The food and service are second to none. We even bring out of town visitors here to show them what quality tastes like. I hope they stay around for another 30 years as I WILL be here!

oevdpTEB0KL634P-LZG5Ow.text: Simply the worst dining experience I've had. From the moment I walked in the experience was just AWFUL. The hostess was rude and not welcoming whatsoever, an older lady that was waiting to be seated even made a remark to her about her rudeness, so I know it wasn't just me that noticed it. We asked to be seated in their "lounge" area as we were planning to have a couple of drinks. Once sat, one waitress came by to take our drink order(mind you we hadn't received drink menus) so we began asking about their drinks and pricing. Her response was that she didn't know, so I asked for a drink menu, she came by, dropped it off and disappeared. About 10 minutes later another waitress came by to take our drink order I inquired about a beer, which was not on the drink menu provided to us, and again the response was that she didn't know. She finally came back after she checked and we placed our drink order. We waited over 20 minutes for two simple drinks, a michelada and a Budweiser in the bottle. Unless they're brewing the beer in the back, I really don't think it should take that long for two beer drinks. But since we were sitting in the bar area, we could see what was taking so long. Clearly this place is a place of "usuals", because two ladies were getting in an altercation and other patrons from all over the bar area knew them by name and the staff caters directly to their usuals. One usual walked in and not even 2 minutes later, her margarita was ready for her at the bar... But I waited over 20 minutes for a simple beer and some tomato juice, that was not tasty at all. When we finally asked if we could order food, the waitress off the bat handed us "to-go" Boxes which was really confusing since we hadn't even placed our order. Sounds welcoming, right? When we finally got our food, it was sub-par, the usual Americanized Mexican food, nothing spectacular as people had raved to me about. About 15 minutes into our meal, the check was dropped off. We weren't asked if we wanted another drink, nothing. We felt we were being rushed out of the establishment. My friend who I was with was not happy and asked when she came by if we couldn't stay to have another drink(hypothetically, because we didn't really want to stay somewhere where we felt unwanted) because it felt like she wanted us out. Her response was that we could stay as long as we needed she had just dropped off the check for when we were ready... But we looked around, and noticed that no other tables around us had checks dropped off, some who had been there longer than us, again the "usuals".  I've seen another review regarding they felt their service was poor due to their race, and my friend who I was with felt exactly the same way. I don't like to make everything about race, but sometimes, it's hard not to.   All-in-all, it was a disappointing experience. I moved here over 10 years ago and always heard about this place, and when I finally had the chance to go, I was excited, but wasn't expecting this experience. I am a self-proclaimed foodie and a localist and this is a local establishment I will not  support again.

EvOsazIzYjT75lJOAiegQg.text: Unfortunately, I really did not enjoy my time at poncho's like my friend described to me. We were visiting Phoenix for a conference so my friend who is from Arizona mentioned Poncho's to me as one of the best Mexican restaurants in Phoenix because President Clinton specifically stopped by for authentic Mexican food. The story sounded very promising so we decided to try it out.   The place was fairly crowded with a line about 30 minutes wait time. You could tell that the place has some history because the decorations are pretty old. Since there was a line, we felt pretty good about it just like my friend said. However, we started to feel differently as the waitress took us to our table through the restaurant. There was a very distinct smell around our table in the room. We couldn't tell whether it was the smell from the kitchen which was next to our table or the smell of old carpet that have been soaked with years of Mexican food. Regardless, what the smell was, it wasn't pleasant so here was the first impression. The menu provided some traditional Mexican food items, which were fairly authentic. However, the chips and salsa were underwhelming at the best. My main dish was again disappointing to the point that I didn't even remember what I ate. This was definitely one of most disappointing meals that I had for a long time. Personally, I will not recommend Poncho's to anyone and will not return to this place again.

TUzOdRTJBDHgWQINWW7qwg.text: I have been a strong supporter of this place for decades. Despite the complaints of people which I knew were True. Yes, they have decent food. Yes, they have decent drinks. But a place who turns a blind eye to their customer being scammed by workers, everyone who pays with a credit card should know that you are at risk of your financial information being hacked. I would think the only way to get around this is to pay with cash or to take your bill directly to bar and pay in front of bartender.   I know realize that they never really cared about their customers, otherwise, they would have changed that dirty carpet by now or replaced it with hardwood flooring.   I know realize that when I walk in with my entire family ( which comprises of 3 adults and 2 toddlers and a baby) and they still consider this a party of 6 people and automatically charge me 18% gratuity ---even when the baby is not big enough to even get a kids meal for herself or drink. You are exploiting my family, your are stealing money from my family and I could drive 2 miles north to Comedor Guadalajara and get a better meal (better looking rice for damn sure) and at a cheaper price. By wait staff and owners who actually engage with customers and look like they want to be there (even if they don't). Comedor Guadalajara had enough sense and care for their customers to rip out their carpet decades ago. It's just unsanitary.   I write this comment with a heavy heart knowing that I can no longer bring myself to come into this place knowing that they do not care about their customers. And that makes me sad.

96a8aCHxTfYERUhS3Imcxw.text: This is Chicano style food, not truly authentic Mexican food. Everything has a bunch of cheese & sour cream and not spicy. Beans have a lot to say about a Mexican restaurant & they're alright.

ST4_aXz2LW3LH-Zzxuf5DA.text: The food was delicious, authentic style Mexican food! The drinks were delicious and not over priced. Food portions are huge! The only downside is that during dinner it's VERY busy, worth the wait!

0SFrqHHAfpZtZ39pTDiWFA.text: This place has really gone down hill!  The hostess is always in a bad mood and rude.  Went to eat there last weekend and seen roaches crawling up the wall.  Lost my appetite.  Service was horrible.  The server forgot to put in our order and never followed up to see how everything was.  I'll probably visit now and again just for drinks in the bar area but not to just go and eat there.  Time to visit one of my other favorite Mexican restaurants.

WPDFLVN7ejKJ_6b3xNBucg.text: HORRIBLE service been here 5-7 x and service hasn't been this bad it's not the greatest but today 8/14/2016 was beyond the most horrible service we got. Took her almost 15 mins to "greet" if that's what you call it because there really was no greet said what do you want. My fiance ask what the Spanish steak was and she literally said " nothing special just a peace of steak" wow so shocked. Then she brings our drinks drops them off at the other end of the table so that WE have to grab them. Food is good that's all your getting here one of the worse customer service restaurants I've been too. This WILL be the last time I come here

5VvorKI8t_h-gsF41IorTQ.text: Really gone downhill. The smell was awful, I could barely finish my food. Food was good, buts its really become rundown. I've been coming here since I was a child, but I won't be back anytime soon.

KTm_O3u5ZbM7GZJo59abSA.text: When you call a day in advance to order a party platter, you expect to have it ready by the quoted time.  They lost our order and we had to wait for them to make it.  Not professional, but the food is good.

zv6oytoSWb13fWC3JRjPCA.text: There lines out the door says it all good mixture of great Mexican food lots of good salsa and chips we have plenty on the menu and they like to keep it a small family owned business it's a great place to get a authentic food if you're in the area

hh7XNPXllFGvEN5tc0iotg.text: I would always go into the restaurant with the best experience and so loved by the employees, but this time it was the most worst experience with service I had possible gotten. Never got forks, literally asked for water 10 times, and on top of the the waitress was arguing with a family sitting behind us that had the most simplest request. Made me not want to eat there again that's how bad it was. Hopefully they get rid of the waitress...

7sutk0ZlxhN3QEsx7GxwAA.text: The fondito burrito is always my go-to at Mexican restaurants. However, the one I had here was the undisputed worst that I have ever tasted. The chicken tasted really old, or perhaps it was the kind canned like dog food. I don't know. The tamales that were my appetizer, were far from appetizing. It was like eating soggy dumplings. By the time I received my burrito, the service was as delightful as the meal. After tasting the vomitous chicken, I told my waitress that I didn't like my meal. She then asked me if I wanted to box it up to go. Seriously?! I asked another waitress(the highlight of my visit) for a manager and asked for recommendations. I must admit, this waitress was very honest with me (after I struck out with my meal). She let me know that the chicken and Carne Asada are sub-par, notified a manager, and removed my meal. So I'm thinking  why doesn't she speak freely to the cook? But that's none of my business. My secondary meal was the sampler. The canned refried beans were the stars. They really outshined the other beef jerky like, leathery meat on the tostadas.

quSTzh8vDroYueKNsFUS0g.text: Rude Hostess. She didn't receive me and my party with a smile at all nor made eye contact with me.

-2bEMn50W1FEZjOJHjV1pw.text: It's my first time being here and already I feel the great energy from the staff. Everyone has a smile and very accommodating. You definitely feel the teamwork between them all. I had the cheese enchiladas and they were really good. The red sauce taste authentic. I'll definitely be back
